loans.name: Maria Yoeli

texts.es:
Maria Yoeli tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada con  2 hijos menores y vive en casa propia. Ella vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope al norte de Peru, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias y cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Ella se dedica a la comercialización  de animales, contando con gran inventario de aves. Precisamente su estrategia es criar a las aves que tiene mayor demanda actual en el mercado (pollo y pavo) y proyectando las que mas se consumen de acuerdo a las festividades tipicas de la zona, donde tiene alta demanda. La mencionada  actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, el negocio esta situado en su domicilio.  

El destino del crédito será para invertir  en compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes y alimento balanceado para aves. Maria ya ha utilizado los servicios de Edpyme Alternativa anteriormente para establecer una pequena tienda en su sala donde vende los productos que cria. De esta manera se ha convertido en la primera bodega de su localidad y quiere seguir consolidando su buena reputacion.
texts.en:
Maria Yoeli is 24 and married. She has two minor children and lives in her own house. She lives in the rural area of Morrope district in northern Peru. This is a small community with approximately 200 families, and has water and electricity services.

She sells animals, and has a large stock of poultry. Her precise strategy is to raise poultry for which there is greater current demand in the market: chickens and turkeys, and to plan for those that are consumed the most during the area's traditional festivals, when she has high demand.

She has been doing this work for three years. The business is located in her home.

The loan will be to invest in the purchase of groceries in greater quantity, and balanced poultry feed. Maria has used the services of Edpyme Alternativa previously, in order to set up a small store in her living room, where she also sells the products she raises.

This way her small store has become the first in her village, and she wants to continue building on her good reputation.

loans.use: To buy groceries in greater quantity, and balanced poultry feed.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosenie requested a 7,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her electric expenses.

Rosenie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Saturnina is 49 years old and has three children who are in school.

Saturnina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Saturnina requested a 23,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Saturnina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es: El señor Santos un productor de 48 años de edad, cliente Kiva, originario de San Antonio comarca del municipio de Pueblo Nuevo- Estelí, de oficio  agricultor se dedica a la siembra de tabaco desde hace 15 años, su nivel académico es hasta tercer año de secundaria, padre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. El dice que su primer crédito fue de gran ayuda porque pudo cubrir los gastos de insumo y el alquiler del terreno para sembrar tabaco lo que genero buenos rendimientos de la cosecha, su primer préstamo lo utilizo para la compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar 5 manzanas de tabaco, pero el desea sacar una mejor producción y ofrecer productos de buena calidad este año es por eso que hoy requiere de  un segundo crédito pero esta vez para invertir en la reparación y mantenimiento de una galera para secar el tabaco, el cual estima este nuevo préstamo será de ayuda ya que podrá mejorar la calidad de sus productos, en su  nueva inversión  recibe el apoyo de sus hijos y Kiva, el espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener su negocio activo, cubrir los costos que genera la producción de tabaco, generar mas ingresos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Señor Santos is a 48-year-old Kiva client, a native of San Antonio district in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo, Esteli. He is a farmer who has been growing tobacco for 15 years. He went to school up to junior high school, and is now the father of five grown-up children. He says his first loan was a great help because it could cover the cost of supplies and the rental of land to grow tobacco, which generated a good crop. His first loan was used for the purchase supplies and labour payment so that he was able to sow five manzanas (8.6 acres) of tobacco. He wants to improve production and offer better quality produce this year, which is why today he requires a second loan. This time he will invest in the repair and maintenance of a tobacco-drying gallery. This will help him improve the quality of his produce, and the development is supported by his children as well as by Kiva. He hopes to have the support of Kiva to keep your business growing, to cover the tobacco production costs, generate more income and to move forward with his family.

loans.use: To invest in the repair and maintenance of a tobacco-drying room

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a frozen-food and seafood retail business. She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more inventory. 

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

She has built her business through her own hard work with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to expand the business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more frozen food and seafood to sell

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
Wilbert tiene 35 años, su pareja es Ruth, de 29 años, y fruto de su unión tienen dos hijos: Anali de 11 y Edison de 5 años, a quienes desean ofrecerle una buena educación.

Gracias a su esfuerzo logró terminar sus estudios, él es Técnico en Computación y se dedica a la reparación de computadoras desde hace 6 años. También brinda los servicios de configuración y cableado de redes. Los ingresos de su trabajo le son muy favorables, gracias a ello está creciendo, y además está ahorrando, porque su anhelo es comprar un terreno donde pueda implementar su negocio.

Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará estabilizadores y cables de red para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilbert is 35 years old. His partner is Ruth, age 29. They have two children: Anali (age 11) and Edison (age 5). Wilbert would like to provide them a good education.

Thanks to his efforts, Wilbert was able to finish his studies. He is a systems technician who has been repairing computers for six years. He also provides configuration and network cable installation services. The income from his work is very favorable and it has allowed him to grow and set aside some savings. His wish is to buy a piece of property where he can set up his business.

The money from this loan will be used to buy power stabilizers and network cables so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy power stabilizers and network cables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda, 65 years old, is married and has three children. She lives in Clarin, Philippines. She sells fish for a living, earning 5,0000 PHP. 

Fernanda joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2009. She has requested a loan of 5,200 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Fernanda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Fredelyn's Group

texts.en:
Fredelyn is 58 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Fredelyn has a  general store, where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for almost a year. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase more stock for the store. In the future, Fredelyn hopes to expand her business.

Fredelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years and is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Felisa's Group

texts.en:
Felisa is 58 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 3 children. 

To earn a living, Felisa has a business selling viand and rice. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Felisa has requested a loan of PHP 14000 to be used in purchasing beef, chicken, meat, rice and other ingredients for her eatery business.

Felisa has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Felisa would like to expand her business. Felisa is the leader of a 2 person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase beef, chicken, meat, rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a cow and add retail stock.

loans.name: Jujie's Group

texts.en:
Jujie is 30 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is married with three children.  Jujie has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed for her hog-fattening business.  

She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to purchase additional piglets.  Jujie is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hog-fattening business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 65 years old. Teodora is married and has two children. To make a living, Teodora owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling crabs and shrimps in the local community. Teodora has been in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Teodora joined GDMPC.  Teodora is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional shrimps to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs.

loans.name: Stanly

texts.en:
Stanly is 45 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with four of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Stanly has been working hard to manage his production business, after which he can sell dry food like maize flour, and also has a milling machine. 

To help expand his business, Stanly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dry food like maize for resale and will help Stanly to generate greater profits and pay her school fees for his children. Stanly hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children up to the university level. 

Stanly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stanly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more dry food like maize for resale

loans.name: Fanuel

texts.en:
Fanuel used his previous loan of 30, 000 KES to buy glass and paint. Since receiving his loan, he has grown his business and employed four people.   

Fanuel is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy timber to make furniture. His dream is to expand his business and employ more people.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture

loans.name: Alidou

texts.fr:
Alidou est un homme âgé de 33 ans. Il est marié å une  revendeuse. Il a 02 enfants âgés de 04 et 01an.  
Alidou travaille comme revendeur de portables et des accessoires de portables dans une baraque depuis 2009. Il est aidé par 01 personne et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Alidou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la marchandise pour vendre à ses clients.
Dans les prochaines années, Alidou voudrait diversifier les marchandises et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Alidou is a 33-year-old man, who is married to a woman who works reselling goods. He has two children, aged four and one.

Alidou works as a reseller of cellphones and telephone accessories in a stall, and has done so since 2009. He is assisted by one person, and gets his supplies from Lomé. He has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise to sell to his customers. Over the coming years he would like to diversify the goods he sells, and to provide for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy cellphones and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Iddriss

texts.fr:
Iddriss est un homme âgé de 35ans. Il est marié à une enseignante et ont ensemble 03 enfants âgés de 12, 08 et 04ans. Deux sont scolarisés.
Iddriss travaille comme revendeur de portables et accessoires de portables dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le terrain. Il est à son quatrième crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille bien éduquée.
texts.en:
Iddriss is a 35-year-old man, who is married to a teacher. Together they have three children aged 12, eight and four, two of whom are at school.

Iddriss works as a reseller of mobile phones and telephone accessories in a store, and gets his supplies from Lomé. The difficulty he faces is the local competition. This is his fourth loan from WAGES, and he has requested it to buy merchandise. He plans to reinvest in his business, and to have a well-educated family.

loans.use: To buy cellphones and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Issac

texts.fr: Mr issaac est un homme âgé de 58ans. Pour mieux prendre en charge sa femme et son enfant  âgé de 26ans, il   vend des habits dans un quartier de la place depuis 2000. Il sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter de la friperie afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Il veut agrandir son activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Issaac is a 58-year-old man. To better provide for his wife and 26-year-old son, he has sold clothing in a neighborhood square since 2000. He has requested his first loan to buy second-hand clothing, so that he can better meet his customers’ requests. Issaac wants to expand his business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr:
Komlavi est un homme âgé de 43 ans. Il est marié å un/e revendeuse.
Komlavi travaille comme maintenancier et informaticien depuis 2009. Il exerce son activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé.
Komlavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une photocopieuse et des ordinateurs pour la prestation de service informatique.
Dans les prochaines années, Komlavi voudrait agrandir l’activité, diversifier les services et assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Komlavi is a 43-year-old man, and is married to a reseller. He has been a maintenance and IT technician since 2009, works in a store, and generally gets his supplies from Lomé.

Komlavi has requested his first loan from WAGES to buy a photocopier and some computers, which he will use to provide his IT service. Over the coming years, he would like to expand his business, diversify the services he offers and provide for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier and some computers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités dans une boutique, Madame Anna est mariée à un commerçant et a 01enfant âgé de 03ans qui est scolarisé. Elle est à son  second crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux demandes de ses nombreux clients. Elle s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Elle  veut agrandir l’activité,  avoir une autre boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Notons qu’elle a débuté en 2006 et est âgée de 28ans.
texts.en:
Anna resells staple goods in a store, is married to a storekeeper and has one three-year-old child who is at school. This is her second loan from WAGES, and she has requested the money to buy more goods so that she can better meet the needs of her large number of customers. 

Anna generally gets her supplies from Lomé. She wants to expand her business, have another store and improve the living conditions of her family. She started her business in 2006, and is 28 years of age.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Booku Diom Kanda Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Booku Diom Kanda" se compose de quatre femmes.Elles sont toutes mariées et ont des enfants.Elles exercent dans le commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques.Elles achètent en gros et se partagent les marchandises en fonction de l'apport de chacune d'elles.Le chef du groupe ( en foulard noir) est mère de trois enfants.Elles vend ses produits à domicile dans une cantine implantée devant sa maison.Les revenus tirés de ce commerce permettent aux femmes de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins mais également d'améliorer les conditions alimentaires de leurs familles respectives.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Booku Diom Kanda Group is made up of four women, who are all married and with children. Their trade is selling fabrics and cosmetics. They purchase the products wholesale and share out between them, accordingly to each other's contribution.

The group's leader (wearing a black scarf in the photograph) is the mother of three children. She sells her products at her home, in a small shop in front of her house.

The income earned from this business enables the women to provide for themselves, but also to improve the feeding conditions of their respective family.

To bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 in order to purchase fabrics and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and cosmetics

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un  employé. Elle a 01 enfant âgé de 15ans qui est scolarisé.
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de biscuits et amuse-gueule au marché  depuis 1999. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sa difficulté est la concurrence sur le marché
Ayoko a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des biscuits et des amuse-gueule. Elle veut agrandir le commerce et créer d’autres points de vente puis épargner.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayoko voudrait devenir une grossiste, assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et avoir une famille aisée.
texts.en:
Ayoko is s 42-year-old woman, and her husband is an employee of a business. She has one child aged 15, who is at school.

Ayoko works reselling cookies and snacks in the market, and has done so since 1999. She gets her supplies in Lomé, and the difficulty she faces is the competition in her market. She has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy cookies and snacks, and plans to increase her business and create other points of sale, and then to save.

Over the coming years Ayoko would like to become a wholesaler, provide for her children’s education and have a well-off family.

loans.use: To buy cookies and snacks.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Ayawa est une femme âgé(e) de 45 ans. Elle est mariée å un conducteur d’engin. Elle a 03 enfants, tous scolarisés. Le premier a 23 ans et le dernier a 19 ans.  
Ayawa travaille comme travaille comme revendeuse de maïs depuis 2004. Elle exerce l’activité dans un marché de la place et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Ayawa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, devenir grossiste et assurer le bien être et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 45-year-old woman, and is married to a bulldozer driver. She has three children, all of whom are at school. Her oldest child is 23 years of age, and the youngest is 19.

Ayawa has worked as a corn reseller since 2004. She works in a market in the square, and gets her supplies from Lomé. She has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy bags of corn. She plans to reinvest in her business, become a wholesaler, and provide for her children’s education and wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy bags of corn.

loans.name: Aurora Del Rosario

texts.es:
Aurora una humilde habitante de Estelí, de 54 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una mejor vida, ella con su antiguo horno artesanal y sus manojos de leña es como trata de ganarse la vida día a día, se dedica a la elaboración de pan y rosquilla  desde hace 25 años, su nivel académico es hasta el quinto grado de primaria pues su situación económica  no le permitió continuar con sus estudios, madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 2 están a su cargo. Ella inicio su actividad desde muy pequeña ayudándole a su mama que también se dedicaba a este negocio de donde ella fue obteniendo experiencia y dominio del negocio, luego se casa, decide independizarse es entonces donde pone su propio negocio de venta de rosquillas, rosquete y pan a la edad de 29 años,  hoy en día con arduo trabajo y esfuerzo propio cuenta con clientes fijos que llegan a su humilde casa a comprar sus productos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que le ayudan con la elaboración del pan y las roquillas, también cuenta con otros ingresos provenientes del esposo que trabaja en una empresa y aporta para los gastos del hogar,  sus productos los comercializa en la misma comunidad y con vendedores ambulante de la zona aunque le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en los supermercados porque pagan a un mejor precio el producto.
Su expectativa es diversificar  sus productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima tales como maíz, queso, sal, los insumos necesarios para elaborar sus rosquillas,  ella estima que el crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá entregar su producción en tiempo y forma a sus clientes lo que generara mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es hacerle mejora  a su vivienda, tener mejores condiciones económica y poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aurora is a humble resident of Estelí.  She is 54 years old.  Aurora is a very hard-working person who strives to provide for her children and offer them with a better life.  She uses her old artisanal oven and bundles of firewood to try and earn a daily living.

Aurora has been making bread and 'rosquillas' (a type of doughnut) for 25 years.  She only studied up to the fifth year of her primary education as her family's financial situation didn't allow her to continue.  Aurora is the mother of five children, two of whom are still in her care.  She started out in this business when she was very young, helping her mom who worked in the same business.  In this way, she gained experience and skill.  After she got married, she decided to work for herself.  At the age of 29, she set up her own business selling 'rosquillas', 'rosquetes' (a type of large doughnut) and bread.  

Through her hard work and effort, Aurora now has regular customers who come to her modest home to buy her products.  She has the support of her children who help her to make her bread and 'rosquillas'.  She also has additional income which her husband makes working for a company and which he puts towards their household expenses.  Aurora sells her products in her own community and also to itinerant vendors in the area though she would love to be able to sell them to the supermarkets because they pay a better price.

Aurora would like to be able to diversify the products that she sells in order to meet her customers' needs.  She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials such as corn, cheese and salt, the supplies she needs for making her 'rosquillas'.  She believes that the loan will be helpful as she will be able to make her products well and deliver them on time to her customers.  This will make her more profits.  Her future plans are to improve her home, be in a better financial position, and get ahead  in life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as corn, cheese and salt

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 6 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Trabalha como padeiro e tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos diversos, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, arroz, óleo, açúcar, sabão, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende adquirir uma viatura para facilitar o escoamento dos produtos para o seu estabelecimento, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o alto custo de vida e os preços elevados dos produtos.
texts.en:
Ernesto is married and the father of 7 children, 6 of whom attend School. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn’t support anyone else.

He works as a baker and has a business selling various products. With this loan he plans to buy products (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future he intends to purchase a vehicle to facilitate the transportation of the products to his establishment and to this end he commits to duly paying off his loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is the high cost of living and the expensive prices of the products.

loans.use: buy products (beer, rice, oil, sugar, soap and others) to increase the quantity of his stock.

loans.name: Ndèye Fama

texts.fr: Ndéye Fama est une femme mariée.Elle est mère de trois enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école.Depuis deux ans, elle vend des tissus et des articles de mercerie.Cette activité lui permet d'entretenir sa famille et de prendre en charge ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des tissus et articles de mercerie.Son ambition est d'agrandir ses activités.
texts.en:
Ndéye Fama is a married woman, and is mother to three children, two of whom go to school. For two years she has sold fabrics and dressmaking items, and this business allows her to provide for her family and to meet her own needs.

To increase her working capital, she has requested a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fabrics and dressmaking items. Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and dressmaking items.

loans.name: Dirfel Keur Bono Peulh Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Dirfel keur bono peulh" se compose de cinq femmes qui s'activent dans l'agriculture et l'élevage.Elles  cultive du mil et de l'arachide.Elles élèvent également des moutons, des chèvres et des vaches laitières. Ces activités assez diverses leur permettent de prendre en charge leurs propres besoins mais aussi de renforcer les conditions alimentaires, sanitaires de leurs familles. Elle sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour renforcer leur fonds de commerce et voudraient acheter des semences de mil, d'arachide et de haricot.Elles ambitionnent d'augmenter leurs surface de culture.
texts.en:
The "Dirfel Keur Bono Peulh" group has five female members, who work in agriculture and livestock farming. They grow millet and peanuts, as well as raising sheep, goats and dairy cows. These diverse businesses allow them to cover their own needs, as well as boosting their families’ food and health conditions. 

They have requested a loan of 500,000 francs to increase their working capital, and they would like to buy millet, peanut and bean seeds. They hope to expand the area of land on which they grow their crops.

loans.use: To buy millet, peanut and bean seeds.

loans.name: Isezerano Group

texts.fr:
Goreth  fait partie du groupe Isezerano et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a  34ans et est mariée à Juma,
Commerçant de poissons. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés  de 5 à 19 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Elle  est  commerçante des ustensiles de cuisine  depuis 3 ans et d’avocat depuis 8ans.

C’est  son  premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’ustensiles de cuisines, à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait  faire l’élevage de vaches et de chèvres, acheter une parcelle et  y construire une maison. Elle voudrait en plus, voir ses enfants continuer les études.
texts.en:
Goreth is a member of the Isezerano group, and lives in Gitega. She is 34 years of age and married to Juma, a fish seller. Together they have three children aged between five and 19 years of age, one of whom is at school.

Goreth has sold kitchen utensils for the past three years, and has sold avocados for eight years. This is her first loan request from Turame and, with the Kiva loan she obtains, she plans to increase her capital and buy lots of kitchen utensils to sell and, therefore, earn more.

Over the coming years Goreth would like to raise cows and goats, buy a plot of land and build a house. She would also like to see her children continue with their education.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy lots of kitchen utensils to resell and, therefore, earn more.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family animal selling business. With the loan investment her husband will buy goats and sheep in their younger age in order to raise and sell them to butchers.  

Yasmeen is a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well.  She has given birth to five children, and all of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.  She is a very confident and hard working lady, positive about the bright future of her family as a result of her husband’s business improvement.

Note:  In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Yasmeen.

loans.use: to buy animals for an animal selling business.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: Jose Alejandro es un joven soltero, tiene mucho deseo de superación, solicita su 1er crédito para mejora de vivienda, poder construir su dormitorio, trabaja como asesor de crédito en una financiera, tiene experiencia en su actividad que desarrolla dia a dia, de esta forma a salido adelante. Sueña con poder su propia vivienda para poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jose Alejandro is a young, single man who has a great desire to do well in life.  He is requesting his first loan so that he can carry out home improvements, building a bedroom.  Jose Alejandro works as a loan officer with a financial institution.  He has experience in the work that he carries out every day.  This is how he gets ahead in life.  He dreams of owning his own home so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Takku liggey 3 kahone" se compose de cinq femmes qui s'exercent toutes dans le commerce de produits alimentaires.Elles vendent des arachides, du mil, des haricots et divers condiments soit devant leurs domicile soit au marché de leur localité.La présidente du groupement est mère de trois enfants. Elles vend des condiments et des légumes sur une grande table installée devant son domicile.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
Takku Liggey 3 Kahone Group comprises five women, who all sell food products. They sell peanuts, millet, beans, and various condiments, either in front of their home, or at the market in their place of residence.

The leader of the group is married and the mother of three children. She sells condiments and vegetables on a large table set up in front of her home.

To bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 in order to buy food products.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Behildes

texts.en:
Behildes is from the city of Mantic, Tangub City. She is 40 years old, married, and has one child. Behildes sells shrimps for a living. She has been in this business for seven years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Behildes joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more seafood products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Nonik

texts.en:
Nonik lives in the Cibubur area. She lives with her parents, is not married, and is still in college. Her parents used to own the business that sells new SIM cards, and also a Ruma’s product. The first Ruma’s product they sell is airtime prepaid minutes.

The reason why Nonik decided to become a Loket Ruma agent is because she wants to serve her customer as a place or agent point where they can pay their monthly electricity bill. Other than this service, she hopes that people will come to her shop to pay their electricity voucher, telecommunication monthly bill, motorcycle installments, and internet monthly bill. 

Hopefully, by becoming a Loket Ruma agent, Nonik will be able to earn money to pay her college tuition.

loans.use: To pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, spices, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is married with 3 children. She is 43 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Philippines. Lorena owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 6,700 to purchase farm chemicals. Lorena has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2010. In the future, Lorena's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia tiene un hijo que se va ha graduarse y quiere que su hijo lo disfrute y para ello necesita cubrir  los gastos como fotografías, vestuario,  pago de la entrega de papelería y con esto se sentirá bien por que su hijo tendrá una recompensa por su esfuerzo.
La Sra. Patricia vive con su esposo quien la apoya en todo momento, su esposo trabaja como chofer de carretera para una empresa de la localidad, los dos han acordado que su mayor deseo es que sus hijos reciban una buena educción y eso les garantice un futuro mejor que el de ellos en la actualidad.
texts.en:
Patricia has a son who is about to graduate.  She would like her son to enjoy this event and so she needs to cover expenses such as photographs, graduation clothing and payment for presentation of papers.  This will make her feel good because her son will be rewarded for his efforts.

Patricia lives with her husband who supports her at all times.  Her husband works as a truck driver for a local company.  The couple have agreed that their biggest wish is for their children to receive a good education so that they can guarantee them a better future than the one they currently have.

loans.use: to cover graduation costs

loans.name: Agnès Liliane Marcelle

texts.fr: Agnès est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 32 ans, fiancée et mère d'un enfant de 10 ans qui va déjà à l'école. elle vit avec son fiancé et encadre en plus de son enfant, deux autres personnes . elle gère un centre d'appel téléphonique dans un quartier de la ville où elle y vend également des crédits de communication, biscuits, bonbons et autres petits consommables.Elle voudrait avec ce crédit renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui va grandissant.elle a pour ambition de faire grandir son activité afin d'augmenter de façon considérable sa marge bénéficiaire, bénéfice qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnès is a young, 32-year-old woman from Cameroon. She is engaged to be married and mother of a ten-year-old child who is at school. She lives with her fiancé and, in addition to her child, has a further two people under her care.

Agnès runs a call center in a neighborhood of her town, where she also sells call credit, cookies, candies and other snacks. With this loan she would like to increase her stock of goods, so that she can better meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. Her ambition is to expand her business so that she has a considerably higher profit, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: LA SRA. AMANDA ESTA SOLICITANDO CREDITO PARA INVERTIR EN MERCANCIA QUIERE TENER MAS VARIEDAD EN PRODUCTO ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA CALZADO Y ARTICULOS DE SEGUNDA MANO, TAMBIEN ES PENSIONADA POR PARTE DE LA PRESIDENCIA Y SU ESPOSO EL SR. TOMAS ES PENSIONADO DEL MAGISTERIO. ELLOS YA PERTENECEN A LA TERCERA EDAD Y NO TIENE DEPENDIENTE ECONOMICOS, ES POR ESO QUE BUSCAN LA MANERA DE GENERAR INGRESOS EXTRA PARA SOLBENTAR SUS GASTOS DIARIOS.
texts.en: Amanda is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise.  She would like to have a wider range of products available.  Her business is selling clothing, footwear and second-hand goods.  She also receives a pension from the town hall and her husband, Tomas, receives a teacher's pension.  The couple are already senior citizens and do not have any dependents.  They are looking for a way to make extra income so that they can cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr:
Yawavi est une femme âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée å un frigoriste. Elle a 2 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Yawavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits de beauté et des pagnes pour tous clients au marché. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de la rupture de stock.
Yawavi a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits de beauté et des pagnes. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yawavi voudrait ouvrir une boutique au grand marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de participer au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a 37-year-old woman, who is married to a refrigerator repairman. She has two children who are at school; the oldest is ten, and the youngest is eight years of age.

Yawavi has worked as a reseller since 2007, selling beauty products and traditional wrap-around cloth (known as “pagnes”) to all the customers in the market. She buys her products in Lomé, and works by herself. Her main difficulty is currently her shortage of stock.

Yawavi has requested her fourth loan from WAGES to buy beauty products and traditional cloth. She wants to reinvest in her business. Over the coming years, Yawavi would like to open a store in the Grand Market of Hédzranawoé. She says that, with her profits, she wants to provide for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy beauty products and traditional cloth.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells gari, a couscous-like grain made out of cassava (tapioca plant). Aba sells the gari at Mfuom near Abura. She has been doing this for five years now. 

Aba is married to a farmer and the couple has five children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their rent and utility bills. Aba will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce her gari. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava (tapioca plant) to produce her gari (couscous-like grain).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr:
Dovi est une femme qui est mariée å un dessinateur. Elle a 4 enfants qui ne vont plus à l’école. Le premier a 40 ans et le dernier a 25 ans.
Dovi travaille comme boulangère depuis 1987. Elle fabrique du pain qu’elle vend pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Dovi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la farine de blé. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dovi voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Dovi is a woman who is married to a draftsman. She has four children who no longer go to school, the oldest of whom is 40 and the youngest 25.

Dovi has worked as a baker since 1987. She bakes bread, which she then sells from home to her customers. She buys her products in Lomé, and works by herself. Her main difficulty is currently her shortage of stock.

Dovi has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy wheat flour. She wants to reinvest in her business. Over the coming years, she would like to increase the size of her business, and says that she plans to use the profits she generates to cover her needs.

loans.use: To buy bags of wheat flour.

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon (in the photo) sells steamed potatoes that she prepares at home and carries to the market to sell. Her husband, Ko, is a construction worker and assists his wife in the business when he is free. They live in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and they have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is married and lives outside the family home; two are construction workers, and another is in school.

The recipient of two previous loans, Yuon is requesting a new one in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motor remoque, a motorbike with a trailer attached at the back, for her husband to start a motor remoque taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a motor remoque for her husband to start a motor remoque taxi business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 37 years old, married, and a responsible mother who takes care of a teenaged kid attending school. Mao is garment worker whose work schedule is  from 7 am until 5 pm. She normally works from Monday to Saturday and gets Sunday off to look after her child. Mao is an expert in sewing clothes, earning approximately USD 5.20 per day by working overtime. She has been in this business for almost four years. Mao's photo was taken in front of her workplace, as shown above.

Mao is now taking out a loan in the amount of USD 1,500 to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy her living needs.  Also, she will use a portion of the loan to purchase four piglets for fattening to sell in the future. She hopes that this loan will have a good impact on her standard of living.  Mao believes that she can attain that quality of life someday.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle and purchase piglets for future sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a fish monger at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. She also sells other food items such as vegetables. Ekua has been in this business for 15 years now. 

She is married to a farmer and the couple has three children. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband with their utility bills. She will use her loan to purchase vegetables and fish. With the additional profit earned, Ekua wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fish to sell.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo) and his wife, Top, are rice farmers. They have been married since 1985 and have two daughters. One daughter is married and still lives in family home while the other one attends school. The family lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophea is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to help raise capital for his son-in-law to launch a fishing business. He will use the money from the loan to buy a boat, boat motor and fishing materials.

loans.use: To buy a boat, boat motor and fishing materials for his son-in-law's new fishing business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa sells charcoal at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. She has been doing this business for two years now.  Adwowa is married and has five children. She uses her income to support her husband's efforts to feed their children as well as pay their school fees.  

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase bulk bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit she earns, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba lives together with her husband and two children at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. Aba sells eggs, which she has done for five years now. She uses her income to support her husband's efforts to pay for their children’s school fees. 

Aba will use her loan to purchase more eggs for sale. With the new profit she earns, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for sale.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco es un pequeño comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, donde vende productos para el consumo familiar como granos, gaseosas y otras cosas,esta solicitando su primer credito con el objetivo de comprar productos para fortalecer el inventario de su negocio y asi poder ofrecerle a su clientela mas productos. En el barrio conocen a don Francisco como una persona muy responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion.  Su mayor deseo es poder ver su negocio solido para poder ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Francisco is a small shopkeeper.  He has a small grocery store in his home where he sells products that families consume such as grains, soda and other items.  He is requesting his first loan with the aim of buying products so that he can strengthen his business inventory and thereby offer his customers more products.  In his neighborhood, Francisco is known as a very responsible person who has a great desire to do well in life.  His biggest wish is to have a solid business so that he can offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Sila

texts.en: Sila is very grateful to all who loaned to him for his business. His business improved and he was even able to complete the loan repayments before the scheduled time. He is asking for a second loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to fund his clothes business. He believes the business has a better future and he will be able to meet the basic needs and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 24-year-old resident of Catadman, Ozamis City. She provides her two children's needs from the little amount of 4,000 she has earned monthly from her own piggery business for three years as an aid to the income earned by her husband. However in 2011, she became a member of GDMPC, and she has applied for a loan at GDMPC micro finance of 4,700 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Cheryl wants to make expansion to her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 24 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.  She is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her cousin as the driver. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her services so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru: Гани трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Более 30 лет он занимается растениеводством и  виноградоводством. У него в селе созданы  условия для работы в сельском хозяйстве, земля плодородная. Гани хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия, чтобы создать уютв  своем доме, с этой целью он запрашивает займ для покупки стропила, ДВП, окон и дверей, а также для кровли крыши жилищного дома.
texts.en:
Gani is a hard-working and kind person. He is married and raising four children. For over 30 years, Gani has been growing crops, including grapes. His village has ideal conditions for agriculture and very fertile land.

Gani would like to improve his living conditions and create comfort in his home. To this end, he is requesting a loan to purchase rafters, fibreboard, doors and windows, as well as to cover the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and repair his house

loans.name: Bahromjon

texts.ru: Бахромчон добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет четверых прекрасных детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми, а иногда в свободное время помогает своему мужу в ведении бизнеса. Бахромчон занимается выращиванием лука, огурцов, ячменя и арбуза. Имеет 3, 20 гектаров посевной земли. Бахромчон хочет получить хороший урожай  и для этого ему необходимо обрабатывать землю, с этой целью Бахромчон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bahromjon is a kind and focused person. He is married and raising four beautiful children. His wife takes care of the household and looks after the children, and in her spare time also helps her husband with his business. Bahromjon cultivates onions, cucumbers, barley and watermelon on his 3.20 hectares of arable land. He would like to bring in a good harvest and so he needs to take good care of the land. To this end, Bahromjon is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, y vive en Tambogrande, en la parte rural de este distrito en el norte de Peru.

La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, ademas se dedica a la agricultura contando con 2,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente y asiste diariamente, cliente cuenta con mas de 8 años en su negocio.

Cliente invertirá en compra de 0,50 has de terreno agrícola, para sembrar mas limón y así seguir creciendo en su negocio, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio. Precisamente, Rene ya ha hecho un prestamo anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa en la cual demonstro ser un cliente responsable.
texts.en:
Rene is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives in Tambogrande, in the rural part of this district, in the north of Peru.

Rene's business is raising pigs and farmyard birds.  He also farms.  He has 2.0 hectares of farmland where he grows lemons which he harvests every week.  He works on this land every day.  He has been in his business for more than eight years.

Rene will invest his loan in buying 0.5 hectares of farmland so that he can grow more lemons and thereby continue growing in his business.  Rene has received a previous loan from Edpyme Alternativa and showed himself to be a responsible client.

loans.use: to buy farmland on which to sow lemons

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta is from Tabid, Ozamis City. She is 62 years old. Crisanta is married and has one child. To make a living, she plants and harvests coconut to sell. She has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Crisanta joined GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a loan of 5,400 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 38 years old, married, and has two children that are aged 1 and 8 years. He operates a retail shop and has one employee. He has been in this business for one year. In addition, he runs a motorcycle transport business.

Since he has become a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his business, because he has been trained in business management skills. He hopes to open another outlet in five years. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio es un cleinte recurrente, de 67 anos, casado y con 1 hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo. Se dedica a la agricultura, para lo cual cuenta con 6.09 has de terreno agrícola en la cual tiene 3.0 has de mango Kent en producción. También cuenta con 2.0 has de terreno agrícola en donde siembra maíz y frijol. Complementariamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor, los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 25 años de experiencia en la agricultura y ganadería. El destino del crédito será para el abonamiento y fertilización del cultivo de mango. Este es su segundo prestamo con Edpyme Alternativa que sera utilizado con fines similares el cual fue muy exitoso para las dos partes.
texts.en: Antonio is an existing client.  He is 67 years old, married, and has one child in his care.  He lives in his own home together with his wife and child.  Antonio is a farmer.  He has 6.09 hectares of farmland.  He is growing Kent mangoes on 3 hectares of his land.  On another 2 hectares he grows corn and beans.  In addition to this, he also raises animals which he sells in the local market once they reach an ideal size and weight.  Antonio has 25 years experience in farming and livestock raising.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his mango crops.  This is his second loan from Edpyme Alternativa and it will be used for similar purposes to his last one which was very successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his mango crops

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme âgée de 27 ans. Elle est marié å un revendeur. Elle a 1 enfant de trois ans qui va à l’école. 
Ayélé travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend des mèches, des tissages et des chaussures pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients.
Ayélé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches, des tissages et des chaussures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayélé voudrait développer son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ayélé is a 27-year-old woman, and is married to a reseller. She has one child, who is aged three and goes to school.

Ayélé has worked as a reseller since 2010, and sells hair extensions, weaves and shoes to all the customers who come to her store. She buys her products in Lomé, and works alone. Her main difficulty is currently the fact that she cannot meet the needs of all her customers.

Ayélé has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions, weaves and shoes. She plans to reinvest in her business. Over the coming years she would like to develop her business, and says that she plans to use her profits to provide for her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions, weaves and shoes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells plantains, rice and soap at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for six years. Efua is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband in the feeding and clothing of their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of soup to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and boxes of soup to sell.

loans.name: Azer

texts.ru: Azer 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Azer jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. Azer uje 15 let kak zanimayetsya etim isskustvom kotoraya privratilas v yego rabotu. Azer iz dereva delayet razniye krasiviyi chasi, ukrasheniya dlya doma, ramki i t.d . On mojet zdelat iz dereva mnogo raznix krasivix izdeliy. Etu svoyu ruchnuyu rabotu on prodayot raznim magazinam , a takje v svoyom masterskom. No Seychas Azer nujdayetsya v 2350 AZN chtobi kupit materili dlya yego raboti v osobennosti on nujdayetsya kupit derevo dlya izdeliy. Etomu delu Azer nauchilsya u svoyego otca eto u nix nasledstvenniy dar a takje ix rabota.
texts.en:
Azer is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives in the Baku region together with his happy family. Azer is a very hard-working man. For the past 15 years, he has been engaged in the art which has become his profession - carving exquisite wooden clocks, home decorations, frames, etc. He can create many different beautiful items out of wood. He sells his handiwork to various stores, as well as directly from his workshop. It was Azer's father who taught him this craft, which is both their profession and their legacy.

Presently, Azer needs 2350 AZN to buy materials necessary for his work, particularly wood for his creations.

loans.use: to buy materials for his woodcarving business

loans.name: Yesenia Marilu

texts.es:
YASENIA DE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, DE ESTADO CIVIL SEPARADA, TIENE 1 HIJA DE 4 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA EN OLMOS AL NORTRTE DEL PERU. EL POBLADO NO TIENE SERVICIO DE ENERGIA ELECTRICA NI AGUA POTABLE, LOS HABITANTES SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA Y A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA DE ANIMALES (OVEJAS, CHIVO, GALLINAS, CERDOS, GANADO). AUNQUE ESTAR SEPARADA PUEDE SER UNA SITUACION DESVENTAJOSA EN ESTA REGION ELLA QUIERE SALIR ADELANTE E INVERTIR EN SU ACTIVIDAD PARA DARLE UN MEJOR BIENESTAR A SU HIJA.

ELLA SE DEDICA A LA COMERCIALIZACION DE ANIMALES (OVEJOS, CABRITOS, GALLINAS, PAVOS, CERDOS), SEGUN EL PRECIO QUE LOS COMPRE, YA TIENE MAS DE 02 AÑOS DE antigüedad EN ESTE NEGOCIO, SUS COMPRAS LO REALIZA EN LOS ALREDEDORES DEL CPM. DE MOCAPE Y LAS VENTAS LO HACE EN LA CIUDAD DE CHICLAYO Y OMOS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA INVERTIR MAS CANTIDAD EN EL COMERCIO E ESTOS ANIMALES PARA ASI TENENR MEJORES GANANCIAS Y PODER INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS COMO INVENTARIO.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 22 years old, separated, and has a 4-year-old daughter.  She lives in her own home, in Olmos, in the north of Peru.  Her village does not receive electricity or drinking water.  The locals work in farming and livestock raising (sheep, goats, hens, pigs and cattle).  Although being separated can be a disadvantageous situation in this region, Yesenia would like to do well and invest in her business so that she can better provide for her daughter's welfare.

Yesenia sells animals (sheep, goats, hens, turkeys and pigs) in accordance with the price she buys them for.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  She makes her purchases on the outskirts of Mocape village and makes her sales in the cities of Chiclayo and Olmos.  She will invest her loan in buying more animals for her business so that she can make better profits and increase both her sales and inventory.

loans.use: to invest in buying more animals for her business so that she can make better profits

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.ru: Fizuli uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya jivotnovodstvom i razvodit ovec. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Fizuli 42 qoda. Ranshe on razvodil korov, no posle togo kak on prodal svoi korovi on reshil razvodit ovec. Fizuli seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota. Fuzuli jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On v budushem xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichit svoi mesachniye doxodi.
texts.en: Fizuli is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in the Baku region together with his family. Fizuli has been an animal farmer for the past 7 years. Previously, he kept cattle, but then sold all his cows and now raises sheep. Presently, he needs 2000 AZN to purchase more sheep in order to increase the size of his herd. In the future, Fizuli would like to expand his business and increase his monthly profits.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité esta compuesto por 10 integrantes, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se han unido con el ideal de poder trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, Blanca, está acompañada con el Sr.  Ramón tiene 1  hijo. Blanca se dedica a la venta de ropa y con los ingresos que ella tiene ayuda a su marido en los gastos de su hogar,  se  integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda seguir creciendo y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, y de esa forma poder tener un buen stock de prendas para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee has 10 members.  They are all friends and neighbors who joined together so that they could work together and help their families.

One of the members of this group is Blanca.  She lives with Ramón and has one child.  Blanca's business is selling clothing.  She uses the income that she makes to help her husband with their household expenses.  She joined her neighborhood committee so that, with the help provided by Fundación Paraguaya, she could continue growing and helping her family.

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing so that she can have a good stock of clothes available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en: Shakeela is a seamstress; she sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number orders every month. The income she earns helps her to pay her utility bills. She has given birth to a son and a daughter, but due to financial constraints, she couldn’t educate her children. Her husband sells decorative items, sceneries (pictures of beautiful places), at different shops in the market. Shakeela has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to further improve her husband’s business. With the loan investment he will buy sceneries to sell for a profit. He has been operating his business for many years and Shakeela is hopeful that the loan will help her husband further his business.

loans.use: to buy decorative items, sceneries (pictures of beuatiful places), to sell.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Expedito” es de la ciudad de Santaní, está integrado por 13 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que se unieron para poder ayudarse y también poder ayudar a sus familias.
Josefa se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y cuenta que es gracias a este trabajo, sumado a su esfuerzo y sacrificio que ha podido crecer como persona y como profesional. Ella sueña con poder tener un gran local y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que tiene un buen pedido de ellas y quiere poder cumplir.
texts.en:
The “San Expedito” committee is from the city of Santaní.  It has 13 [female] members who are very hard working and entrepreneurial.  They joined together so that they could help each other and also help their families.

Josefa's business is selling all kinds of clothing.  She says that, thanks to her work, effort and sacrifice, she has been able to grow as a person and also as a professional.  She dreams of having businesses premises where she can continue offering good products to her customers.

Josefa is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing as she has a good order for these goods and would like to be able to fill it.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
This is Crisanta, 50, a  resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a married to Bonifacio, her business partner, and they have one child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Crisanta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Crisanta dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea, 40, is a married woman with two children. She lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

She plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and now earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Andrea has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She is requesting a loan of 8,100 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Rose Gen

texts.en:
Rose Gen is married and works hard to support her family. 

She has a food business in the Philippines. Rose Gen has been in this business for three years now, and she also earns additional income from her general store.

Rose Gen requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy pork, chicken and ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Rose Gen would like to save enough money to build and expand her general store.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo ella habilito un bar en su domicilio de los prestamos que fundación paraguaya le otorgo, hoy día su negocio ha crecido debido al empeño que le puso. Su deseo es seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que el crédito le ha servido de mucho, para la apertura de su bar y para que sus hijos hayan podido terminar su colegio y siga una carrera.
Ella solicita nuevamente la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para poder abastecer su bar con bebida de todo tipo, ya que siempre tiene mucha demanda y quiere poder cumplir con ellas.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) committee was formed as a result of some promotional work that was carried out in their neighborhood.  All of the group's members are from the same area.  They are acquaintances and neighbors.  The aims of each and every member are to work, foster a supportive spirit, and reach the maximum level of the program.

Petrona is the president of this group.  She used loans from Fundación Paraguaya to set up a bar in her home.  Her business has grown through the hard work that she has put in.  Her wish is to continue working with Fundación  Paraguaya as their loans have been very helpful to her in terms of opening her bar and enabling her children to finish school and study at college. 

Petrona is requesting Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva's help again so that she can stock her bar with all kinds of drinks because she always has a lot of demand and she would like to be able to meet it.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her bar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sow yuca root.

loans.name: 4 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta en el 4º ciclo del programa, esta integrado por 10 señoras, todas son vecinas, conocida de la zona.  Las integrantes de este grupo "4 de Octubre", son muy  unidas y  mantienen excelente conducta de pago. Esperan seguir el grupo llegar al nivel maximo  del programa "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras".
Edita es la presidenta de este trabajador grupo, y cuenta que por medio de la venta de queso y cría de pollos ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Edita día a día muestra que con trabajo y dedicacion se puede salir adelante, enseña a sus amigas mediante su ejemplo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de queso, con lo que podrá tener su producto en cantidad para poder seguir trabajando y a la vez seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
This committee is in the 4th loan cycle of the program. It is made up of 10 ladies, who are all neighbors and well-known throughout the area. The members of this group, “4 de Octubre” [4th of October] are very close and they have an excellent payment record. They hope the group will continue progressing to the maximum level of the program “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Committee of Enterprising Women].

Edita is the president of this hardworking group and she says that through her cheese sales and chicken breeding she has managed to get ahead and help her family. Everyday Edita shows that with hard work and dedication it is possible to get ahead. She leads her friends by example.

She is requesting the loan to purchase cheese, which she will have in a quantity that will allow her to continue working and at the same time help her family.

loans.use: to purchase cheese to sell on.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon tiene 35 anos, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia. Cliente vive en la zona Urbana cuenta con servicios de agua y luz , el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.
La actividad que desarrolla Ramon titular es comercio de animales, desde hace cinco años, contando con la experiencia necesaria para el manejo del negocio. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto de la labores derivadas de la pesca artesanal.
 
El destino del crédito será para invertir  en la culminación de acabados de su domicilio, como son tarrajeo de paredes y fachado, con el anterior crédito otorgado cliente culmino el techado total de sus paredes.
texts.en:
Ramon is 35 years old, he has two children and he lives in his own house. He lives in an urban area which has electricity and water supplies. It is a small community with approximately 200 families. 

Ramon has been working in animal trade for the past five years, relying on the experience necessary for the running of this business. He also generates additional income from his work as a small-scale fisherman.

The loan will be invested in the completion of finishing touches in his home, such as cementing the walls and the façade. His previous loan was used for roofing.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in the completion of finishing touches in his home, such as cementing the walls and the façade.

loans.name: Mujeres Actuales Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Mujeres Actuales, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, quien queriendo ayudar a sus amigas las invito a formar un grupo.  El comité se encuentra  en el primer ciclo, están ayudándose las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
 Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Gabriela, quien se dedica a la peluquería. Comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y que luego gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo lo fue levantando poco a poco. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes, tijeras, peines, shampoo, enjuagues y demás productos para poder seguir trabajando y dando un buen trabajo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Actuales" committee was formed through the initiative of one of its members who wanted to help her friends and so invited them to set up a group.  The committee are in their first loan cycle and are helping each other so that they can all get ahead in life.

One of the women who belongs to this committee is Gabriela.  Gabriela is in the hairdressing business.  She says that she started out with a small business but, thanks to her efforts and work, she is gradually boosting it.  She is a very hard-working person who has a great desire to do well and continue growing her business.

Gabriela is requesting this loan to buy dyes, nail polish, scissors, combs, shampoo, conditioner and other products she needs in order to continue working and providing her customers with a good service.

loans.use: to buy dyes, nail polish, scissors, combs, shampoo, conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Guarani - Ka’Aguy Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guarani - ka’aguy esta integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias por medio de ese trabajo en conjunto. Ellas son jefas de familia que tienen a su cargo mantener la casa y la familia.
Francisca es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella nos cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás, gracias a este trabajo ha logrado ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por ninguna necesidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas y edredones, que son sus principales productos, a la vez agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Guarani-Ka’Aguy Group is comprised of 11 hardworking and entrepreneurial women that hope to be able to get ahead and help their families by means of working together.  They are the heads of their households and have to care for their homes and their families.

Francisca is one of the members of the group and she tells us that every day she begins work very early in the morning and works all day.  She sells all types of products door-to-door, such as bed sheets, blankets, quilts and more.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help her family and provide what they need so that they are not lacking for any basic necessities.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy bed sheets and quilts, her most important products.  At the same time she is thankful for this opportunity for herself and her friends.

loans.use: to buy quilts and bed sheets.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 52 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Rosie sells meat. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this work. 

Rosie  has a requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more meat for her meat shop.

Rosie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosie would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for her meat shop.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 48 years old, married and has three children, age 18, 20 and 24.

She sells scrap metals and shoe soles for recycling. She has been in the business for three years.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Through this, she has managed to employ two people in her business.

She hopes to own a piece of land in future and open another outlet of her business. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy scrap metals for resale.

loans.use: To buy scrap metals.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 53 years old, married, and has eight children.  She lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Susana has a grocery store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for two years. 

Susana is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase additional groceries to sell.  Susana has been a member of PMPC for almost two years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 34 years old, married, and has two children.  She owns a retail shop where she sells animal feeds and fertilizer, which she has been doing for for 10 years.  She also farms to earn additional income.

Salome is requesting a loan for 55,000 KES, which she will use to buy animal feed and fertilizer. Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to expand her business in five years.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jamilla's Group

texts.en:
Jamilla's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Jamilla is 22 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort portal region of Uganda.  For the past year, Jamilla has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Jamilla is  requesting a loan for 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks to sell and will help Jamilla to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jamilla hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Jamilla is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jamilla's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Imelda is married and has two children.
