Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por eso agradece la oportunidad por tantos años de confianza depositada. Al igual que en ocasiones anteriores, menciona que será puntual en los pagos.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de papas, los que llevará hacia las ciudades costeras del país, para su venta como semilla.
texts.en:
Adela, 42, has three children. With her husband and her children, she lives in her own home that has been built with the work of both her and her husband over many years. 

For 18 years, she has made a living in agriculture: sowing potatoes of distinct varieties such as “Yungay”, “Perricholi”, “Canchán”, “Tomasa”, and others of high demand.  The fertile soil in her zone allows her to obtain quality products. “The taste of the potato in my zone is special, that is why I sell my products every time I go to the market,” she says.  In addition, 5 years ago she decided to go outside of her city and take her products to the coastal cities.  There her products are well accepted in seed form.  Sometimes her harvest is not enough for the number of buyers, for this reason she has to buy several sacks of potatoes from other farmers.  In this way, she works in harmony with her partner for the well-being of her family. 

This is her 11th loan with MFP and she is grateful for the opportunity of so many years of trust. As in the past, she says she will be punctual with payments.  She will use the money to buy several sacks of potatoes which she will take to the coastal cities of the country to sell in seed form.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Kayi est une femme âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un employé. Elle a 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 3 ans.
Kayi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2004. Elle vend des tissus pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Kayi a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus,des déodorants et des parfums. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kayi voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kayi is a 46-year-old woman.  She is married to an employee and has four children who all attend school.  Her oldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is 3.

Kayi has been working as a reseller since 2004.  She sells fabrics to all clients from her home.  She buys her products in Lomé and works alone.  At the moment, her main difficulty is that she is out of stock.

Kayi has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy some fabrics, deodorants and perfumes.  She wants to reinvest in the business.

In the coming years, she would like to open a shop.  She says that with the profits, she is planning to take care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, deodorants, and other various items.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla tiene 53 años, tiene cinco hijos, pero ya no viven con ella porque son mayores de edad. Ella y su pareja viven juntos en la casa que su padre le cedió. 
Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo obtuvo gran destreza en la producción de verduras como zanahorias, arvejas, habas, maíz, papas y otros. Con el apoyo de su esposo puede abastecerse para atender todos sus cultivos, que se ubican a gran distancia de su vivienda. Uno de los inconvenientes que siempre tiene que afrontar es “la helada”, (clima muy frío) que en los meses de mayo, junio y julio azotan sus cultivos, pero ella es inteligente y sabe cómo enfrentar los problemas climáticos. Leyla cuenta con semillas de papas y arvejas que cosechó en una temporada anterior, por eso esta vez invertirá en la compra de bolsas de abono. “En agosto es la temporada de arvejas donde los precios son buenos”, menciona. En los siguientes días iniciará con la preparación de sus terrenos, para ello contratará personal, a quien pagará al día.

Este es el crédito número 5 que adquiere de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión hace la fuerza”, donde sus socias son personas solidarias.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá completar el capital que tiene guardado para la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Leyla, 53, has five children but they no longer live with her as they are all grown.  She lives with her partner in the house her father gave her. 

For 20 years she has made her living in agriculture.  In all of this time, she gained great skill in the production of vegetables like carrots, peas, beans, corn, potatoes, and others.  With the support of her husband, she is stocked up to tend to all of their crops which are located a great distance from her home.  One of the problems she must always face is “la helada”, [very cold weather] that in the months of May, June, and July afflict her crops.  But she is intelligent and she knows how to face problems in the weather.  Leyla has potato and pea seeds that she harvested in prior seasons, this time she will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer.  “August is the pea season when prices are good,” she says.  In the next few days, she will begin with the preparation of her land.  For this she will hire personnel which she pays per day. 

This is the 5th loan that she has gotten from MFP, she gives her word that she will make her monthly payments on time.  She is part of the communal bank “La Union hace la fuerza”, whose members are supportive people. 

With the money from this loan she will be able to combine it with the money she has saved to buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina tiene 40 años, su pareja es Roberto, con quien tiene tres hijos: Frank, Jean y Derlis. Todos juntos viven en una casa rústica que alquilan ubicada en el distrito de La Unión. 
Hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y tíos. Cuenta con terrenos propios que adquirió en todos estos años con trabajo arduo, pero también arrienda parcelas, así su producción de zanahorias, papas, maíz y lechugas puede abastecer los pedidos y demandas que sus compradores le hacen. Toda su cosecha la vende en el mercado central de la ciudad. Y gracias al poyo de su esposo puede cubrir todas las labores del campo. “Es cansado, todos los días salimos de madrugada para limpiar, abonar o cultivar mis productos”, menciona. Además, también obtiene ingresos extras de la venta de los conejos que cría. Faustina desea ampliar su producción para generar más ingresos, por eso arrendará más terrenos y pagará a los operarios, para ello necesitará inversión.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, por ello espera de este apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos.
Invertirá el dinero en el pago de los operarios que contratará para limpiar su terreno y sembrar zanahorias y lechugas.
texts.en:
Faustina is 40 years old. She and her partner Roberto have three children: Frank, Jean and Derlis. Together they live in a cottage they rent in the district of La Unión.

She has dedicated her time to agriculture for 20 years, having learned her skills from her parents, aunts and uncles. She has her own land, acquired over years of hard work. She also leases other plots so she can grow enough carrots, potatoes, corn and lettuce to supply her customers' needs. She sells ​​her entire crop in the city's central market. With the support of her husband, they can cover all the farm work. "It's tiring, every day we go out before dawn to weed, fertilize or tend my crops," she says. In addition, she raises extra income by breeding and selling rabbits. Faustina wants to expand their crop production to generate more income, so she would like to lease more land and pay workers, for which she will need investment.

She belongs to the "Union is Strength" community bank and this is her fifth loan with MFP, so she hopes she will be able to access this financial support to pursue her goals. She will invest the money in paying labourers to clear the land and sow carrots and lettuces.

loans.use: To pay for labour to clear her land for cultivation.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 44 años, su pareja es Wilfredo, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero solo viven con tres de ellos. Su casa es propia, la construyeron a base de mucho esfuerzo y está ubicada en la localidad de La Unión, Leticia.
Gracias al apoyo incondicional de su esposo, Edith sigue un camino hacia el progreso. Actualmente tiene dos casas y está ahorrando para adquirir un camión para facilitar su trabajo. Se dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años, es una mujer inteligente y buena negociadora, ya que sus productos se venden a buen precio. “Yo vendo al por mayor, toda mi producción se la llevan para Lima (capital del país)”, menciona orgullosa. En sus terrenos de cultivo siembra, arveja, habas, papa y maíz. Ella viaja por lo menos tres veces por semana hacia la ciudad capital. En esta actividad invierte en transporte y operarios para cargar y descargar su mercadería. Por eso piensa adquirir un camión, así sus gastos se reducirían. Está contenta con su trabajo porque al sembrar arveja invierte poco y obtiene mayores utilidades en corto tiempo, por eso esta vez sembrará arvejas.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de bolsas de fertilizante para optimizar el crecimiento de las arvejas que piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Edith is 44 years old. With her partner Wilfredo she has had five children, but only three of them live. They own their house, which they built with their own hard work and which is located in the town of La Unión, Leticia.

With the unconditional support of her husband, Edith is on a path to progress. Currently she has two houses and is saving to buy a truck to make her work easier. She has worked in agriculture for 15 years, and is an intelligent woman and a good negotiator, as their products are sold at good prices. "I sell in bulk, all my produce is taken to Lima (the capital city)," she says proudly. In their farmland, she plants peas, beans, potatoes and corn. She travels at least three times a week to the capital. This activity is expensive in transport and in paying workers to load and unload their goods. So she is thinking of buying a truck to reduce the costs. She is happy in her work: sowing peas requires little investment and makes a good profit in a short time, so this time she will sow peas on her land. 

She belongs to the "Union is Strength" community bank and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She promises to be timely with her repayments.
She will invest this money in buying bags of fertilizer to optimize the growth of the peas she plans to sow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her crop of peas

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bread store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more bread to sell in her bread store.

Maricar has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Maricar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell in her bread store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old, widowed and has four children. 

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cresty

texts.en:
Cresty works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Cresty requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Cresty would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 46 years old and married with one child.

Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elma has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Elma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marilou has a bakery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for baking.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, sugar, cheese and other ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia Yony continua dedicandose a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,ella cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio,la socia a la vez continua trabajando en un hotel ella trabaja seis dias a la semana ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.


La socia solicta el prestamo para la compra de alimentos para sus animalitos como maiz.
La socia se siente feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estabalecidas.
texts.en:
The member, Yony, continues with her farm work and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells to customers who place orders.  She has been in business for some time, and it is going well because of the hard work she puts into it.  She also still works at a hotel six days a week and is a very responsible person who is determined to help her family get ahead.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy animal feed such as corn.  The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed such as corn.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años, tiene dos hijos: Priscila de 13 y Brandon de 10 años. Junto a su pareja y sus hijos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito agrícola de La Unión, Leticia.
Hace 14 años se dedica a las labores del campo al lado de su esposo, juntos trabajan la tierra para mantener a su familia. En estos años aprendió a producir zanahorias, arvejas, habas, papas, maíz y otras hortalizas. Ella menciona que el producto que más satisfacciones le da es la arveja, ya que invierte una bolsa de semillas de 550 soles y le arroja como 60 sacos que vende a 120 soles cada uno. Eso en temporadas buenas, ya que hay meses donde los precios llegan a bajar, pero María se recupera con la venta de sus otros productos. Con esta actividad puede otorgarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida sin que carezcan de las necesidades básicas. Su meta es mejorar y aumentar su producción de hortalizas aprovechando los suelos fértiles de su localidad. Por eso también arrendará otras parcelas.

Este es el segundo crédito que obtiene de MFP, por eso se siente comprometida de pagar las cuotas con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión hace la fuerza”, menciona que sus compañeras son personas solidarias, se siente a gusto.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus sembríos de arvejas y papas.
texts.en:
María, 32, has two children: Priscila, 13, and Brandon, 10.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented house in the farm district of La Unión, Leticia.

For 14 years she has been working in the fields alongside her husband, and together they provide for the family.  Over the years she has learned how to grow carrots, peas, lima beans, potatoes, corn and other vegetables.  She says the crop that gives her the most satisfaction is the pea, since a bag of seeds costing 550 PEN produces 60 sacks that she sells for 120 PEN each.  That is in the high season, because there are months when the prices gow down, but María compensates this by selling other products.  This trade allows her to give her children a good quality of life with all the basic needs taken care of.  Her goal is to improve and increase her vegetable production, taking advantage of the fertile soil where she lives.  She also wants to rent more land.

This is her second loan through MFP, and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "La Unión hace la fuerza", and says her colleagues are supportive people so she is happy to be a member.

She will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer for her pea and potato crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Laura Ligia

texts.es:
Laura es madre y padre para su hijo Mateo. Los dos residen en la parroquia de Nanegalito, ubicada en la capital del Ecuador, Quito. La ciudad de Quito está situada en la cordillera de los Andes a 2800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, haciéndola la 3era capital más alta del mundo. En 1978, Quito fue nombrado Primer Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO por un paisaje que combina naturaleza e infraestructura de una manera única en su categoría. Quito se divide en tres partes: el Centro Histórico; donde se preserva el Quito colonial, el Norte; donde tradicionalmente se sitúan las clases socioeconómicas altas, y el Sur; conocido como “el lado pobre” de la ciudad. 
Laura se dedica a la crianza de animales y su comercialización y a cuidar a su hijo de 5 años. Comenzó su negocio hace 3 años y, a pesar de trabajar 8 horas diarias para sacarlo adelante, no tiene los ingresos necesarios para dar una vida más digna a su hijo Mateo. Laura tiene todo el deseo de salir adelante por su hijo, y tiene fe en que si invierte en su negocio lo puede lograr. Por lo tanto, ella solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder incrementar el número de animales y poder mejorar la distribución de los mismos. De esta manera ella puede tener más ingresos para su familia y luchar por el futuro de su hijo.
texts.en:
Laura is both mother and father to her son, Mateo.  They live in the Nanegalito Parish, located in the capital city of Ecuador, Quito.  Quito is in the Andes Mountains, at 2,800 meters above sea leve, making it the third highest capital in the world.  In 1978, Quito was desginated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site because of how it combines nature and infrastructure in a unique way in its category.  Quito is divided into three parts: the Historical Center which is Colonial Quito, the North, where the upper classes live and the South, known as "the poor side" of the city.

Laura raises and sells animals, and takes care of her five-year-old son.  She began her business three years ago and, although she spends eight hours a day working hard to get ahead, she does not have enough income to give her son, Mateo, a decent lifestyle.  Laura is determined to provide for her son and she is confident that if she invests in her business, she will be able to do it.  Therefore she has requested a loan through Kiva to increase the number of animals she raises and improve sales.  This will allow her to earn more for the family in her struggle to provide a better future for her son.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Léma

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales et des céréales à domicile et au marché, Madame Léma est âgée de 37ans. Son conjoint est docker au Port Autonome de Lomé et ils ont ensemble 02 enfants qui sont âgés de 07 et 04ans. Un seul fréquente. C’est en 1996 qu’elle a commencé l’activité et elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son second crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES lui permettra de se réapprovisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Elle veut renforcer son activité, assurer l’éducation des enfants et aider son mari dans les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Léma is 37 years old and she resells grains and general food products from home and at the market. 

Her husband is a docker at the Autonomous Port in Lomé, and together they have two children, ages 4 and 7.  Only one of her children goes to school.

She started her business in 1996 and she stocks up in Lomé. 

With this second loan, which she is requesting from WAGES, she will replenish her supplies of goods in order to better meet her customers' needs.  

She wants to strengthen her activity, take care of her children's education and support her husband in taking care of the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Mamacha Rosario - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” en el  distrito de Huancarani de la provincia del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas principal de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, elaboración de muebles de madera, venta de artesanía, venta de productos de primera necesidad, venta de combustibles, venta de chicha y cerveza, crianza de animales menores y otras actividades.      

(La señora Victoria está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Victoria nació en la ciudad de Huancarani y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cinco hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la Victoria es la venta de combustibles como gasolina y petróleo, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de combustibles y lubricantes pero también se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papa y cebada, ella compra combustibles de uno de los grifos cercanos a la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar combustibles, lubricantes y aditivos.   
 
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las personas que aparecen en la parte izquierda de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends established the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" in the district of Huancarani, province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.  This group is comprised of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead who work hard on a daily basis to provide a better future for their children.   The main businesses members are involved in are: food sales, wood furniture carpentry, craft sales, basic needs sales, fuel sales, beverage sales, small animal farming and others.

(Victoria is the one raising her hand in the photo).  Victoria was born in the city of Huancarani, where she still lives.  She is 43, married and has five children.  Her main business activity is the sale of fuels such as gasoline and oil.  She has a small fuel and lubricant shop, but she also farms and grows potatoes and barley.  She buys the fuel at a pump near the city of Huancarani.  For several years, she has been in business and it is going well because of the hard work she puts into it.  On this occasion, Victoria is requesting a loan to buy fuels, lubricants and additives. 

The members are grateful for the opportunity and committed to paying back their share of the loan on time.  (The people pictured in the photos to the left arrived late for the group meeting).

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, in the very heart of the old city of the Incas.  It is a tourist area known for its archeological and historical centers, its landscape, history, and for being an enchanting city in the southern part of the country.  Cusco is a very touristic, commercial area, known for its Inti Raymi traditional festivities and for having one of the seven wonders of the world: "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy fuel, lubricants and additives.

loans.name: Lucio Alejandro

texts.es:
Lucio nació en la provincia de Imbabura al norte del Ecuador en 1978, pero en la actualidad vive con su esposa e hijos en la parroquia de Nanegalito, ubicada en la capital del Ecuador, Quito. La ciudad de Quito está situada en la cordillera de los Andes a 2.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, haciéndola la 3era capital más alta del mundo. En 1978, Quito fue nombrado Primer Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO por un paisaje que combina naturaleza e infraestructura de una manera única en su categoría. Quito se divide en tres partes: el Centro Histórico; donde se preserva el Quito colonial, el Norte; donde tradicionalmente se sitúan las clases socioeconómicas altas, y el Sur; conocido como “el lado pobre” de la ciudad. 
Luis se dedica a la crianza de animales y su comercialización trabajando 12 horas diarias desde hace dos años. Lucio se lamenta porque nunca tuvo la oportunidad de continuar sus estudios secundarios ni universitarios, pero, a pesar de esa limitación, tiene fe en que si invierte en su negocio va a poder sacar adelante a toda su familia. Por lo tanto, él solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder incrementar el número de cerdos y poder mejorar la distribución de los mismos. De esta manera el podrá tener más ingresos y podrá dar la oportunidad de educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucio was born in 1978 in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador.  He lives with his wife and children in the Nanegalito Parish, in the capital city of Ecuador, Quito.  Quito is in the Andes Mountains, at 2,800 meters above sea leve, making it the third highest capital in the world. In 1978, Quito was desginated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site because of how it combines nature and infrastructure in a unique way in its category. Quito is divided into three parts: the Historical Center which is Colonial Quito, the North, where the upper classes live and the South, known as "the poor side" of the city.

Lucio raises and sells animals, and has been working 12 hours a day for the last two years.  He is sorry that he never had the opportunity to continue with his secondary education or go to college, but, despite this limitation, he is confident that if he invests in his business he will be able to help his family get ahead.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan through Kiva to increase the number of piglets he has and improve sales.  This will give him more income and the opportunity to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Rosalie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her 8 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college, and to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Ma. Luz has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and earns additional income from fish vending.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Lucille has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Délasse

texts.fr:
Delasse est une femme âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un comptable. Elle a 03enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 15ans et le dernier 07ans.
Delasse travaille comme couturière et revendeuse de produits de mercerie, des pagnes et des bazins depuis 1993. Elle exerce seule son activité à domicile, de façon ambulante et s’approvisionne généralement à Lomé. Sa  difficulté principale est l’achat à crédit de ses clients. Elle sollicite son quatrième prêt à WAGES pour acheter des bazins, des pagnes et des articles de mercerie.
Dans les prochaines années, Delasse voudrait voyager elle même pour commander les bazins chez les grossistes et mieux satisfaire les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Délasse is a 43-year-old woman, married to an accountant.  She has three children who all go to school.  Her oldest child is 15, the youngest is 7.

Since 1993, Délasse has been working as a seamstress and reselling sewing supplies, "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and damask fabrics.  She works alone, from her home and as an itinerant seller, and she usually stocks up in Lomé.  Her main difficulty is that her customers sometimes pay on credit.  

She is requesting her fourth loan from WAGES for the purchase of damask fabrics, "pagnes" and sewing supplies.

In the coming years, she would like to be able to visit wholesalers in order to choose and order damask fabrics directly from them.  She would also like to take better care of her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy damask fabrics and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa sigue con su comercio de venta de ropa, zapatos, productos plásticos, que desde hace varios años, comercializa para el apoyo de su familia, su esposo trabaja de tornero, apoyando a los gastos.
Hoy en día, solo apoya con los estudio a una hija, es por tal razón, ha venido trabajando con más empeño en su negocio, colocando mas sus productos, ya que se gasta mucho en los estudios.
Parte de esta inversión, en su crecimiento ha sido el aumento de mercadería que atreves de financiamiento ha sido posible. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: ropa para dama y caballero, cosméticos de la Avon y productos variados en plásticos,
texts.en:
Rosa continues with her business selling clothing, shoes, and plastic products, which she started several years ago to support her family.  Her husband is a lathe operator and she helps with the household expenses.

Nowadays, she has only one daughter she is providing an education for, so she is working harder, selling more products, to cover education costs.

Part of her investment, which the loan made possible, went toward expansion to increase merchandise sales..  The new loan will be used to buy women's and men's clothing, Avon cosmetics and a variety of plastic products.

loans.use: To buy plastic products, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Dionesia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store. Dionesia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Dionesia has been sustaining her business activities through her 3 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une veuve âgée de 53 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 23 et 35 ans et parmi lesquels  deux vont encore à l'école.Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place depuis 6 ans où elle vend des fruits  et des vivres secs(farine de manioc). La durée moyenne de rotation de son stock est de 3 jours.elle voudrait ce crédit pour s'approvisionner en grande quantité ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle grandissante et d'accroître son bénéfice.Bénéfice qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de réinvestir dans son activité dans le but de l'agrandir car elle a pour ambition d'occuper la position de leader dans ce secteur d'activité.
texts.en:
Bernadette is a 53-year-old widow, and mother to three children aged between 23 and 35 years of age. Two of her children are still at school. She has worked for six years selling fruits and dried goods (cassava flour) in a market in the square. Her stock rotation period is on average three days. 

Bernadette would like this loan to buy large quantities of supplies, which would allow her to better meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base and increase her profits. These profits would help her to meet her family’s needs and reinvest in her business. She plans to do this to increase her business, as her ambition is to be the leader in this sector of activity.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr:
Adjoavi est une femme âgé(e) de 51 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et a 02 enfants qui ne fréquentent plus. L’ainé a 27ans et le dernier 22ans.
Adjoavi travaille comme revendeuse de KOM (nourriture faite à base de maïs qui se mange avec de la sauce tomate  et du poisson frais.
Adjoavi a requis son troisiéme crédit afin d’acheter des sacs de maïs. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjoavi voudrait augmenter son stock et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Adjoavi is a 51-year-old woman who is married to a driver. She has two children who no longer go to school; the oldest is 27 and the youngest is 22 years of age. 

Adjoavi works reselling “kom” (a corn-based food which is eaten with tomato sauce and fresh fish). She has requested her third loan to buy bags of corn. Over the coming years, she would like to increase her stock and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Souleye

texts.fr: Soulèye est un jeune marié et père de deux enfants.Il exerce un métier de chauffeur de taxi depuis trois ans. Avec cette activité, il parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Malheureusement, son taxi est tombé en panne.ce problème fait qu'il n'arrive plus à supporter correctement les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. C'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret de 500000f afin d'acheter un nouveau moteur.Son ambition est de changer tous les organes du taxi.
texts.en:
Soulèye is a young married father of two. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years, and this business allows him to meet his family’s needs. Sadly, his taxi has broken down, and he cannot correctly provide for his family’s expenses.

Soulèye has therefore requested a loan of 500,000 francs to buy a new engine. His ambition is to replace all his taxi’s internal parts.

loans.use: To buy a new engine.

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Madame Absa habite  au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis plus de 20 ans dans le commerce et la vente de denrées alimentaires tels  que poissons séchés ou fumés, pâte d’arachide.  Elle est soutien de famille et a à sa  charge 6 enfants. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de  500 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement  de son fond de roulement. Elle compte acheter avec son financement les produits qu’elle commercialise dans  le but d’accroitre d’avantage ses bénéfices et élargir  son activité de commerce. Son projet futur est de disposer des moyens d’offrir à ses enfants de grands magasins de produits divers qui leur permettront de s’occuper.
texts.en:
Absa lives in Senegal. For more than 20 years she has bought and sold food items such as smoked and dried fish and peanut paste. She provides for her family, and has six children under her care. 

Absa is a member of the U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 500,000 francs to increase her working capital. With her loan she plans to buy products for sale, so that she can increase her profits and expand her business. In the future she would like to have the means to provide her children with large stores where they can keep busy selling various products.

loans.use: To buy dried and smoked fish and peanut paste for resale.

loans.name: Landing

texts.fr: Monsieur Landing est un commerçant  marié  qui pratique l’activité de mareyeur  dans une usine du village  depuis plus de 20 ans. Il a en charge  3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre  3 et 6 ans.  Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour acheter du poissons qu’il va   revendre aux commerçants. Son vœu  est de devenir un grand mareyeur indépendant dans le futur.
texts.en:
Landing is a married trader who has worked as a fish wholesaler in a factory in the village for more than 20 years. He has three children under his care, aged between three and six years of age.

Landing is a member of a U-IMCEC branch, and has requested a loan of 200,000 francs to buy fish for resale to traders. He hopes to become an important independent fish wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with four children. Erlinda is 53 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for 36 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional fish to sell.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to engage in other type of business. Erlinda is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yessenia sigue su negocio de productos ferreteros, el cual trabaja junto con su esposo en un pequeño tramo, en una terminal de buses, en donde la gente trafica mucho. De sus hijos solo dos están con ella, y por tal razón sigue esforzándose para el bien comun de la familia.
Yessenia ha comprado más productos en manguera, lámpara de mano que es más demandada por los clientes, entre otros productos que aumentado gracias a los préstamos otorgados en Afodenic, con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en lámpara de mano, enchufes, tijeras, clavos, pega, desarmadores, alambre para luz, lámparas, martillos, llave crece, tubos de agua, sellador, cuchara de albañil entre otros productos, para mantener sus ventas, ya que la demanda es mucha.
texts.en:
Yessenia continues in her business selling hardware.  She works together with her husband on a small stretch in a bus terminal which is very busy with people.  Two of her children still live with her and so she continues working hard for the good of the family.

Yessenia has bought more products such as hosepipes and flashlights, which are what her customers request the most of, and other products thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic.  She will invest this new loan in buying flashlights, plugs, scissors, nails, adhesive, screwdrivers, electrical wire, lamps, hammers, wrenches, water pipes, sealant, trowels and other products so that she can maintain her sales because she has a lot of demand.

loans.use: to invest in buying hardware

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
This is Leticia, forty-nine, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jose, a driver, and is a mother to three children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Leticia operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and gowns exists all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Leticia hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hangarid

texts.en:
Hangarid, twenty-six, lives with his wife and a son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Tosontsengel, Mongolia. His son is four years old and goes to kindergarden. His wife helps with his business. He started planting organic potatoes and some organic vegetables in 2010. He owns two hectares of land. 

His business income is not sufficient to support his family. In order generate more income, he needs to expand his business. He is planning to plant different kinds of organic vegetables on his land. His land is located far away from his house. For this reason we couldn't take his photo in his place of business. He is a hardworking and good natured man. He says "My wife and I support our family by planting some vegetables on the land we own. I want to plant different organic vegetables. In order to expand my business, I need to buy more organic vegetables seeds". He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more organic vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en: Togtohbayar is 58 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. He started his traditional farming business in 2007. He owns several livestock. He produces all sorts of products such as: organic milk, cashmere, wool and meat. He is well known to the suppliers for his natural products. He is very concerned about his products. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I don't use any chemicals on my livestock. My products are all naturally produced". He needs more sheep to sell a bigger amount of organic milk. He's requesting 2,700,000 MNT to buy sheep and to buy bicycle for his son.

loans.use: To buy sheep so he can sell more organic milk and to buy a bicycle for his son.

loans.name: Cochalitas Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “COCHALITAS” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de  Senkata, está compuesta por siete integrantes donde la señora Delia es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de gorras y sombreros, tejidos de awayos, tejido de mantas, venta de estantes, venta de artefactos electrónicos, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras. 
La señora Delia cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por una promotora; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos electrónicos, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para diversificar su mercadería (compra de electrodomésticos) los que comprarán del departamento de Oruro y posterior lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones de crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The “COCHALITAS” community bank are starting their first loan cycle as part of the Senkata regional office.  This group has seven members and Delia is the group's president.  The business activities that the members are engaged in are varied and include: selling caps and hats, weaving 'awayos' (traditional cloths), weaving blankets, selling shelves, selling electrical appliances, running a neighborhood store and selling vegetables.

Delia says that this is the first time she has joined a Pro Mujer community bank.  She was invited to do so by a loan officer.  Delia's business is selling electrical appliances.  She has been in this business for several years, having learned it from her friends.

Delia will use the loan she is taking out to diversify her merchandise.  She will buy electrical appliances in Oruro department and then sell them from her fixed sales location.  This work helps her to support and provide for her family.  Delia is married and has three children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Delia replied that she likes the training sessions about loans and health.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with seven children.  Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

She has borrowed and paid for eight loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns income from pig fattening.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: 05.01.05 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến operates a food stall/restaurant selling nem chua (fermetter/cured pork). Tiến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Tiến is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with one dependent child in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province, the other one of her children is grown up.

She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 05 Chợ Điện Biên solidarity group. In 2009, Tiến  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tiến has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main harship that Tiến faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Tiến hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es socia del Bancomunal Ccori Ayllu, tiene 38 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres  hijos. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa y por otra parte de dedica al bordado de correas. Está  agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece. Le gustan mucho las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal ya que las charlas que le dan le ayudan a mejorar su negocio y en su familia pero sobre todo lo que más resalta es que aprendió a ahorrar. La meta de Catalina es  brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos y que sean buenos profesionales. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá  en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, bebidas para su tienda.
texts.en: Catalina is a member of the Ccori Ayllu community bank.  She is 38 years old and the single mother of three children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years and owns a grocery store in her own home.  She also embroiders belts.  Catalina is grateful to the institution for the loans that they offer.  She enjoys the training sessions that she receives as a member of her community bank because the chats help her to improve her business and her family situation.  Above all, what she emphasizes the most is that she has learned how to save.    Catalina's goal is to provide her children with a good education so that they become good professionals.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles and drinks for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles and drinks for her store

loans.name: Mireille Flore

texts.fr:
Mireille Flore est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 32 ans, célibataire et mère de 03 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 16 mois et 13 ans et parmi lesquels 02 vont à l'école. elle a pour activité un salon de couture et elle bénéficie de 04 ans d’expérience dans le domaine. elle coud les vêtements pour femme, enfant, ainsi que les tissus de décorations. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait acheter 08 roulots de tissus qui seront destinés à la couture des tenues de classe pour élèves qu'elle mettra sur le marché pour la prochaine rentrée scolaire.
Elle a pour ambitions pour sa structure de l'agrandir et elle voudrait également acheter terrain.
texts.en: Mireille Flore is a young Cameroonian woman who is 32 years old, single and mother to three children, whose ages range from 16 months to 13 years old; two of the children go to school. As an activity she has a sewing workshop and benefits from four years' experience in this field. She makes up clothes for women and children as well as sewing decorative fabrics. With this loan she would like to buy eight rolls of fabric which she will use to make up school clothes for pupils and sell them on the market for the coming school year. Her ambition is to to expand her workshop and she would also like to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy eight rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es:
Gaudencio tiene 63 años, está casado con Julia, con quien tiene cuatro hijos, quienes ya dejaron el hogar para formar sus propias familias. Gaudencio y su esposa viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi.
Él es un hombre mayor pero con las fuerzas de un joven. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, por eso no puede ver su vida lejos del campo. Cuenta con 4 hectáreas de terreno donde produce papas de diversas variedades. Al cosecharlas en 4 o 5 meses aproximadamente, las lleva a las ciudades costeras del país, viajando cientos de kilómetros, así asegura buenas ventas. Tan favorable son sus ventas y contactos en la costa, que también adquirió terrenos por esa zona, por eso Gaudencio viaja con frecuencia. Todo esto no hubiese sido posible sin el empeño que siempre muestra en todas sus actividades y el apoyo incondicional de su esposa e hijos. 

Este es el crédito número 12 que recibe de MFP por lo que se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas, como lo hizo antes. Es un socio entusiasta del banco comunal “Capital semillera” y se siente contento de tener un grupo sólido.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de abono y fertilizantes orgánicos para llevarlos hacia sus terrenos en la costa, ya que en esas zonas áridas los abonos no tienen la calidad que él requiere.
texts.en:
Gaudencio is 63 years old and married to Julia.  The couple have four children who have already left home to form their own families.  Gaudencio and his wife live in their own home, in Huasahuasi district.  He is an old man but he has the strength of a young man.  He has been farming since he was a child and so he cannot imagine his life far from the countryside.  He has 4 hectares of land where he grows different varieties of potatoes.  When he harvests them, in approximately 4 to 5 months, he takes them to the coastal towns, traveling hundreds of kilometers in order to guarantee good sales.  His sales and contacts on the coast are so favorable that he has also acquired land in this area.  This means that he travels frequently.  None of this would have been possible without the determination that he always shows in his work and the unconditional support of his wife and children.

This is Gaudencio's 12th loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time as he has in the past.  He is an enthusiastic member of the 'Capital Semillera' community bank and he feels happy to belong to such a solid group.

Gaudencio will invest this money in buying manure and organic fertilizers which he will take to his land on the coast because the fertilizers found in these arid areas are not of the quality he requires.

loans.use: to buy manure and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is widowed with two children. Lorna is 53 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Lorna sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for a year. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to be used to purchase additional snacks to sell. Lorna became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Lorna hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional snacks to sell.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mrs Hong was born in 1953. She has four children whom all have their own families. Her husband is a member of the blind association of Dong Anh province. His income is 7,000,000 VND a month. Mrs Hong grows fruit trees and raises chickens for a living. She gets 3,000,000 VND a month. The total income of her family is 10,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND over 50 days to invest in her farm.

loans.use: to invest in her fruit tree and chicken farm.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon, 56, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a carpenter, and is a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Corazon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Corazon dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs Dung was born in 1985. She has a little three-year-old baby. Her husband sells fried ducks and fried chickens in the market. He makes 4,000,000 VND from this work. 

Mrs Dung sells ducks and chickens in the market too. Each month she earns 3,000,000 VND, thus the total income of her family is 7,000,000 VND. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND over 50 weeks to buy more ducks and chickens to re-sell.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chickens to resell.

loans.name: Vui

texts.en: Mrs Vui was born in 1957. She has three children: two daughters who got married and a son who is going aboard ships. Her husband is dead. Mrs Vui works as a worker for an irrigation company. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has taken part in SEDA's credit program since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 8,066,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,810,000 VND over 50 weeks to breed ducks and chickens to sell.

loans.use: to breed ducks and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Nondote

texts.fr:
Nondote est un homme âgé de 37 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a un enfant âgé de 3 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école. 
Nondote travaille comme agent de santé depuis 2009. Il soigne tous les patients qui se présentent à lui dans son cabinet. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille avec 2 personnes. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le manque d’argent pour acheter les médicaments.
Nondote a requis son quatrième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Nondote voudrait avoir une grande clinique de renommée internationale. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de se vivre heureux avec sa famille.
texts.en:
Nondote is a 37-year-old man who is married to a hairdresser. He has a three-year-old child who does not go to school yet.

Nondote has been a health agent since 2009. He looks after all the patients who come to his consultancy, and buys his products in Lomé. He works with two people, and his main difficulty is currently a lack of funds to buy his medication.

Nondote has requested his fourth loan from WAGES to buy generic products, and he wants to reinvest in his business. Over the coming years, he would like to have a large, internationally-renowned clinic. He says that he plans to use his profits to live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To buy medical items.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Cheikh est un homme marié.Il est père de deux enfants dont l'un fréquente l'école.Il gère un magasin de vente d'articles informatiques, de téléphones portables et d'accessoires.Son commerce lui permet de s'occuper de sa famille et de prendre en charge ses propres besoins.En plus, il investit une partie de ses bénéfices dans l'aviculture pour diversifier ses sources de revenus. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour faire une nouvelle opération en achetant 300 poussins de chair.Son ambition est de construire un grand poulailler.
texts.en:
Cheikh is a married father of two children, one of whom goes to school. He runs a store that sells IT items, cellphones and accessories. His business allows him to provide for his family, as well as to meet his own needs.

He also invests part of his profits in raising poultry, to diversify his sources of income. Today he has requested a loan of 400,000 francs for a new purchase, and plans to buy 300 broiler chickens. His ambition is to build a large poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy 300 broiler chickens.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Sam N°10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Takku ligguey SAM N 10 " est composé de 5 membres qui sont toutes mariées.Elles exercent des activités de commerce de produits alimentaires.Elles achètent en gros des légumes, du poisson, du mil ou des arachides qu'elles revendent en détail.Cette activité leur rapporte des revenus assez consistants qui leur permet de subvenir à leurs besoins et de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de leurs familles respectives.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de  250000f pour acheter des produits alimentaires.
texts.en:
The "Takku Ligguey SAM No. 10" group has five female members, all of whom are married. They sell food products, and buy wholesale vegetables, fish, millet and peanuts which they then resell on a retail basis. This business provides them with a constant income, allowing them to meet their needs and provide for their respective families.

To increase their working capital, the group members have requested a loan of 250,000 francs to buy food products.

loans.use: To buy staple foodstuffs.

loans.name: Abina

texts.fr: Abina est un femme âgée de 37ans. Elle est veuve et a un enfant de 20ans qui est scolarisé. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes, bazins et des céréales à domicile et dans un marché de la place à toutes personnes depuis 2005. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour s'approvisionner en marchandises à Lomé(céréales et pagnes). Elle veut réinvestir dans l'activité, assurer sa prospérité et avoir une famille épanouie.
texts.en:
Abina is a 37-year-old widow, who has one 20-year-old child who is at school. She resells “pagnes” (traditional wrap-around cloth), damask and cereals to all kinds of customers from home and in a market in the square, and has done so since 2005. 

To better meet the needs of her customers, Abina has requested a second loan from WAGES to obtain supplies of merchandise from Lomé (cereals and pagnes). She plans to reinvest in her business, ensure her prosperity and have a well-off family.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth and cereals.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 64 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with four children.  Rosita has a hog-fattening business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase feed for her hog-fattening business. 

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to purchase additional piglets.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: La Restauration Group

texts.fr:
Mme  Minata  est la représentante du groupe  LA RESTAURATION. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 22 ans et  le moins âgé a 10 ans. 04 vont à l’école .Elle a 08 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des gâteaux depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de cissin en ville. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter  01 bidon d’huile de 20l, 01sac de farine de blé, 01 sac de sucre et 01 charge de bois. 

Mme épargne ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en:
Minata is the representative of the LA RESTAURATION group. She is a married mother of six children, the oldest of whom is 22 and the youngest ten. Four of her children go to school, and she has eight people under her care.

Minata has sold cakes for the past eight years. She gets her supplies from a market in the town of Cissin, and her customers are friends and neighbors.

She plans to buy one 20-liter drum of oil, one bag of wheat flour, one bag of sugar and one bale of wood. Minata saves her profits, and she plans to open a large restaurant

video.title: Kiva Borrower MINATA from Burkina Faso

loans.use: To buy one 20-liter drum of oil, one bag of wheat flour, one bag of sugar and one bale of wood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fabrics and dye products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and widowed with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and paid for 16 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
This is Eufemia, 56, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco and is the mother of nine children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Eufemia operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are locals, tourists, neighbours and the community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente femme  entrepreneur,  âgée de 67ans est  membre du groupe de crédit safina. Mère de 9 enfants  tous scolarisés  et mariée à un homme ayant pour profession l’enseignement. Elle est vendeuse des divers articles de cuisine depuis  2009 ; elle avait commencé son activité avec  un capital de 100$ avant de bénéficier du crédit de Hekima mais à ce jour après  7cycle de crédit chez Hekima  elle a son propre capital de 600$ hors crédit. Ce nouveau crédit  doit lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 10douzaines des assiettes en mélanines, en plastiques et des casseroles.  Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, finir leurs études et être grossiste dans le jour avenir. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions et prie Dieu de le bénir d’avantage.
texts.en:
The client, age 67, is a woman entrepreneur and a member of Safina Group. She's the mother of nine children who all attend school, and she's married to a man working as a teacher. 

Since 2009, she's been selling various kitchen items. She started her business with a capital of $100 before getting her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima. Today, after seven loans from Hekima, her own capital amounts to $600 (loans excluded).

This new loan will be used to buy ten dozen plates in melamine and plastic, as well as saucepans. She would like to see her children grow and complete their studies, and she would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

She therefore thanks Hekima for its actions and pray that God may bless it even more.

loans.use: to buy ten dozen plates and saucepans

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rene, a farmer, and is the mother of two children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Angelina operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower and dahlias as well as a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are locals, tourists, neighbours and the community.  She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies needed in her business

loans.name: 05.01.01 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. Thúy has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main hardship that Thúy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thúy is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 01 Chợ Điện Biên solidarity group. Thúy lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Two of her children are grown up.

In 2009, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Thúy hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken is 25 years old, a single woman who permanently lives with her mother and siblings in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She operates a small store in the village, selling grocery items like cookies, noodles, beverages, soaps, shampoos and household products to local people in the commune. She usually extends a friendly service to her customers, which is why there are many customers using her products. Typically she is able to make an average of 4.50 USD per day to contribute to support the family.

Ken is now looking for a loan in the sum of 1,500 USD to purchase a motorcycle for personal use. Also, with the remainder she will buy beverages, sweets, spices, canned goods and cosmetics to sell in her store to increase her merchandise. She hopes to receive this loan as her second loan so she is able to make improvements in her business and generate more income. Ken thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for personal use and buy grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Fils

texts.fr:
Fils est né au Rwanda et a 26 ans, il est marie avec 1 enfant de 2 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 2 ans de secondaire.

Fils est commerçant qui a un business d’enseigner des gents à conduire donc il a une auto école. C’est son cinquième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une voiture qui va lui aide dans ses activités d’enseigne des étudiants à conduire des véhicules de différents catégories de conduire dans son auto école.

Pour faire croitre son activités, il planifie d’acheter d’autres véhicules et d’autres  matériels qui va l’aide à aide son auto école à enseigner d’autre catégories de conduire. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir son activité et ouvrir d’autres autos école dans d’autres parties du pays. Avec les profits, il prévoit de bâtir une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Fils is born in Rwanda. He is 26 years old and married, with a two-year old child.
Fils is an entrepreneur who runs a business teaching people to drive automobile, that is, a driving school. This is his fifth loan cycle with ACV. He will use his credit to buy a car to help him teach students how to drive vehicles of various categories.

In order to grow his business, he plans to buy other vehicles and supplies so that his school can offer  instruction for different categories of driving licenses. In the years to come, he would like to grow his business and open other driving schools in other part of the country. He plans to use his profits to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a car to help him teach how to drive vehicles of various categories.

loans.name: Gladiz Maruja

texts.es: Gladiz es socia del Bancomunal Ccori Ayllu, tiene 45 años de edad y es madre de un hijo que ahora cursa los estudios universitarios. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 15 años y es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa y también se dedica a la  compra y venta de tara y cochinilla. Está agradecida con la institución por las facilidades de préstamo que le ofrece y dice que en las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ofrecen charlas que contienen mensajes de vida para que puedan mejorar en sus  negocios y familias, lo que más le ha gustado es que aprendió a ahorrar. Su meta construir una casa en el terreno que ha logrado comprar. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor de tara y cochinilla y también comprará abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en: Gladiz is a member of the Ccori Ayllu community bank.  She is 45 years old and the mother of one son who is in college.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years and owns a grocery store which is located in her own home.  She also buys and sells tara powder and cochineal (dyes).  She is grateful to the institution for the loans that they offer and says that the training sessions she attends as a member of her community bank contain life messages which enable her to improve her business and family.  What she has most enjoyed is learning how to save.  Gladiz' goal is to build a house on a plot of land that she has managed to buy.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying tara powder and cochineal wholesale.  She will also buy groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy tara powder and cochineal wholesale.  She will also buy groceries for her store

loans.name: François

texts.fr:
François est né au Rwanda et a 31 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfant de 8 mois à 4 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

François est Eleveur. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter une vache moderne.

Pour faire croitre son elevage, il planifie de solliciter d’autres crédit pour améliore son élevage. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  être un éleveur des vache de race améliore. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’épargne pour son élevage et assure le bien être de sa famille. François est aussi salarie.
texts.en:
François was born in Rwanda and is 31 years of age. He is married and has two children aged eight months and four years of age. He studied six years of primary education.

François raises cattle, and this is his first loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy a modern breed of cow. 

To increase his cattle raising business, he plans to request other loans to improve his cattle-raising. Over the coming years he would like to raise an improved breed of cattle. He hopes to use his profits to save to raise these animals, and to ensure his family’s well-being. François also has a fixed salary.

loans.use: To buy a modern breed of cow.

loans.name: C0002 Twitezimbere - Burera Group

texts.en:
Helene is 48 years old.  She is married with six children between the ages of 15 and 26 years.  In addition, she takes care of nine relatives. 

Helene is the leader of the group called "C0002 TWITEZIMBERE - BURERA" in local language and she is the one pictured above with her had raised.  She sells beans and wheat.  She has three years of experience in this work and currently employs eight people to help her. 

Helene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fertilizer for cultivating large quantities of beans and wheat for resale.  Any profits generated from this loan will enable her to save money for the future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for cultivating a  large quantities of beans and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es:
Balbino tiene 58 años, está casado con Adela, con quien tiene cinco hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos y un nieto de 11 años. Su casa es propia, la que le tomó mucho esfuerzo construir, ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi.

Desde que tenía 20 años se dedica a la agricultura y en todo este tiempo se dio cuenta que sus productos son más rentables si los vende en la costa del país. “Siembro papa de todas las variedades y llevo casi toda mi producción a otras ciudades como semilla”, menciona. Para realizar estas ventas debe viajar de 300 a 500 kilómetros. Además de las papas también produce arvejas y habas, pero estas las comercializa en su misma ciudad. De esa manera ha conseguido construir su casa y brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.

Este es el crédito número 9 que recibe de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Capital semillera” y es uno de los grupos más sólidos de su localidad.
El dinero de este préstamo lo destinará en la compra de bolsas de fertilizantes para una parte de sus cultivos de papas que cosechará dentro de un mes.
texts.en:
Balbino is 58 years old and married to Adela.  The couple have five children but only live with two of them and an 11-year-old grandson.  They own their own home which they worked hard to build.  It is located in Huasahuasi district.

Balbino has been farming for 20 years and, over the years, he realized that his produce is more profitable if he sells it on the coast.  "I sow all different varieties of potatoes and take nearly all my production to other towns as seed", he says.  In order to make his sales, he must travel between 300 and 500 kilometers.  As well as potatoes, he also grows peas and green beans but he sells these in his own town.  Working in this way, he has managed to build his own house and provide his children with a good education.

This is Balbino's ninth loan from MFP and he takes care to make his repayments on time.  He is a member of the 'Capital Semillera' community bank which is one of the most solid groups in his town.

Balbino will use the money from this loan to buy bags of fertilizers for some of his potato crops that he will harvest in a month's time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his potato crops

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
The Santi Pala group is located in Melaya village, Jembrana, West Bali. Most of the inhabitants work as farmers. The dry season they are facing today requires them to find different types of plants suitable for the dry season to increase their income. The group chooses to plant beans and other types of crops.
