They need additional funds to purchase seeds and fertilizer. 10 of the men, who have similar businesses, joined together in a group and sent their proposal to MUK to have a loan. In addition to getting venture capital loans, they also received training from MUK.

I Wayan is the head of the Santi Pala group. He used the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. With this loan he hopes he can cultivate the land properly in order to produce the maximum yield and that the final result will improve the family's economy. One member couldn't attend the meeting because of sickness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Astou Sarr

texts.fr: Madame Astou Sarr  tient une table dans le marché local ou elle vend des produits halieutiques et  d’autres produits alimentaires. Elle a une expérience de plus de 25 ans dans ce domaine. Elle a démarré avec très peu de fond. Elle se ravitaille dans la zone centre du Sénégal. Elle est à son 4ème crédit et veut renouveler pour acheter du poisson séché et des moules.  Astou Sarr  est mariée et mère de famille .Elle appui son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Elle aimerait améliorer  son activité en cherchant des fonds.
texts.en:
Astou Sarr has a table in the local market, where she sells fish and other food products. She has more than 25 years’ experience in this field, and started off with very little capital. She gets her supplies from the central part of Senegal. This is her fourth loan, and she wants to use it to buy dried fish and mussels. 

Astou Sarr is a married mother. She supports her husband with the daily household expenses, and would like to improve her business by looking for additional capital.

loans.use: To buy fish products: smoked and dried fish, as well as vegetables.

loans.name: Ya Wel Junior N°1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Ya wel junior n°1" est composé de cinq femmes.Elles pratiquent un commerce de produits cosmétiques.Certaines vendent leurs produits à domicile alors que d'autres les vendent dans leurs cantines installées devant leurs domiciles.Elles prennent en charge leurs propres besoins avec les revenus tirés de cette activité .Elles participent aussi à la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles. Afin d renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elle sollicitent un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
The "Ya Wel Junior No. 1" group has five female members, who all sell cosmetic products. Some of them sell their products from home, while others sell them in the little stores they have set up in front of their houses. 

The women cover their own needs with the income generated by this business, and they also help to meet the expenses associated with supporting their families. To increase their working capital, the members of the group have requested a loan of 250,000 francs to buy cosmetic products.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.fr: anastasie est une femme de 46 ans mariée mère de 05 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 et 30 ans. Elle a aussi trois de ses petits fils qui sont à sa charge et 3 de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle a pour activité la vente des vivres (arachides, piment,oignons, gombo)depuis 2 ans déjà. elle n'a pas un gros capital, ce qui l'oblige à acheter ses marchandises en petites quantités, attendre de tous vendre pour pouvoir s'en procurer d'autres. d'où la rupture permanente des stocks et l'insatisfaction de sa petites clientèle qu'elle a acquise. en augmentant son capital, elle pourra non seulement augmenter son stock de marchandises satisfaire sa clientèle en évitant les ruptures de stocks, vendre plus et donc augmenter ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans l'activité et économisera l'autre pour les rentrées scolaires de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Anastasie is a 46-year-old married mother of five children, aged between 18 and 30. She also has three of her grandchildren under her care, and three of her own children are still at school.

Anastasie works selling foodstuffs (peanuts, pepper, onions and okra), and has done so for the past two years. She does not have a lot of capital, which means she has to buy her merchandise in small quantities, wait until it is all sold, and then buy more. This leads to a permanent stock shortage, and dissatisfaction among her small customer base. 

If she increases her capital, not only will she be able to increase her stock, but she will also meet her customers’ needs by avoiding stock shortages, be able to sell more, and see her profits increase. Anastasie plans to reinvest part of her profits in her business, and will save the rest for when her children go back to school.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Maty Laye

texts.fr: Madame Maty Laye est une enseignante de profession. Elle habite dans une des communautés villageoises du Sénégal. Elle enseigne le français  depuis 2001 dans une école privée de sa localité d’habitation. Elle est salariée et a déjà remboursé 2 prêts  antérieurs au sein du guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou elle est membre. Elle sollicite  un crédit de 300 000 frs avec lequel elle compte assister un de ses parents proches   en situation difficile a  honorer  un engagement envers un tiers. Ce financement  pourra contribuer à  assurer l’équilibre  social  au sein de sa famille. Son vœu  est d’acquérir une école privée et gérer  elle-même la direction.
texts.en: Maty Laye is a teacher by profession and lives in a village community in Senegal.  She has been teaching French in a private school in her town since 2001.  She earns a salary and has already repaid two previous loans from her U-IMCEC office.  She is requesting a loan for 300,000 francs which she plans to use to help a close relative to honor a commitment made to a third party.  This loan will enable her to ensure social stability within her family.  Her wish is to acquire a private school and run it herself.

loans.use: to honor a commitment which a relative has made to a third party

loans.name: Roukeyatou

texts.fr:
Roukeyatou est une femme âgé(e) de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 02 enfants, dont 01 à l’école. 
Roukeyatou travaille comme revendeuse de produits génériques  au marché depuis 2002. Ses difficultés sont les méventes et la concurrence sur le terrain. Elle sollicite son second crédit de WAGES pour acheter des produits génériques afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et s’occuper du bien – être de la famille.
texts.en:
Roukeyatou is a 31-year-old woman, who is married to a retailer. She has two children, one of whom is at school.

Roukeyatou has worked reselling generic pharmaceutical products in the market since 2002. The difficulties she faces are the slump in sales and her competition. She has requested her second loan from WAGES to buy generic pharmaceutical products, which will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers. She wants to increase her sales and look after her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Mariée  à un agent  dans une société de la place, Madame Ablavi  âgée de 37ans   est mère de 04 enfants tous à l’école. L’ainé a 14ans et le dernier 04ans. Pour contribuer aux dépenses du ménage, elle a commencé par vendre en 2003 les produits de premières nécessités (lait, sucre, riz, huile végétale et autres) dans une boutique. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente et elle sollicite ce second crédit  pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut dans l’avenir augmenter son commerce si possible ajouter une autre activité secondaire et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is married to an agent who works in a company in her town, and is 37 years of age. She has four children, all of whom go to school. The oldest of her children is 14, while the youngest is four years of age. 

To help cover the household expenses, Ablavi started selling staple goods (milk, sugar, rice and vegetable oil, among others) in a store in 2003. Her main difficulty is the slump in sales, and she has now asked for a second loan to buy general foodstuffs. In the future she wants to expand her business and, if possible, add another secondary business to ensure the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: To buy general food products.

loans.name: Shehide

texts.en:
Shehide is from Kosovo. She is married and is a mother of four children. She lives in the village. The main source of income for the family is agriculture.  

Shehide wants to expand her farm, but she lacks the necessary funds. This loan will help her to purchase a cow. It is important for Shehide to be able to produce and sell more agricultural products and get more income. This will help her cover the family's costs and ensure financial stability for them.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.fr: Clémentine est une commerçante âgée de 40 ans, mariée mère de 09 enfants qui vont tous à l'école. elle dispose de 03 autres personnes en sa charge pour un total de 12 bouches à nourrir. elle vend de la banane et du plantain dans un marché de la ville depuis 04 ans. elle fait dans la vente en détail et s'approvisionne dans les villages voisins et des zones périphériques de la ville. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter de la marchandise en grande quantité et vendre en gros auprès des détaillants. ce qui génère un peu plus de revenus. Elle voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir aider son époux à supporter les charges domestiques
texts.en:
Clémentine is a forty-year old shopkeeper; she is married and the mother of nine children who all attend school. She supports three other persons, for a total of twelve dependents. She has been selling bananas and plantains at one of the city markets for four years. She gets her supplies from markets in neighboring villages and in the city suburbs.
With this new loan, she would like to buy large quantities of merchandise and sell it wholesale to retailers, which will generate slightly higher revenues. This will allow her to help her husband cover the household expenses.

loans.use: acheter de la banane et du plantain en grande quantité

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un homme marié, père de quatre enfants dont les trois fréquentent l'école primaire.Il exerce l'activité d'aviculture en achetant des poussins de chair qu'il élève avant de les revendre à maturité.Cette activité lui permet de renforcer cesb revenus et de mieux prendre en charge les besoins d'entretien de sa famille. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'aviculture, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 250 poussins.Son ambition est de construire un grand poulailler.
texts.en: Ibrahima is a married man and the father of four children, three of whom are attending elementary school.  Ibrahima is in the poultry farming business.  He buys broiler chicks which he raises and then sells when they are grown.  This business allows him to strengthen his income and better provide for his family.  In order to start a new poultry farming operation, he is requesting a loan for 200,000 francs to buy 250 chicks.  His ambition is to build a large henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 250 chicks

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is from Kosovo. He is married, and is the father of three children. Halim is working as a welder and he is the only person in his area who works in this profession. This  businness is main source of income for his family.

He applied for a loan from Kiva partner KosInvest to buy working tools and raw materials. these tools will help him improve his business. When he doesn't have enough work as a welder, he is trading woods.

loans.use: To buy working tools for his welding business

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. Phuong was born in 1981. Her husband is an iron worker at Da Hoi. He gets 5,000,000 VND each month. Her sons are learning at the primary school. She has a hair-cutting service, and she earns 3,000,000 VND per month from it. She has been participating in the loan programs of SEDA since 2011. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid that loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND within 50 weeks to invest in her barber shop. Then, she hopes her business can get enough money so that she can pay for her children’s education fees.

loans.use: To invest in her barber shop

loans.name: Liljana

texts.en:
Liljana is from Kosovo. She lives in a Serbian community she is the married mother of seven children and is a regular client of KosInvest. She started her business selling toys to children in a rented shop. Now she has bought the shop and sells various types of toys, jewelry, pools for children etc. Her shop is near a lake and she also serves the Albanian population. 

With this loan through buying more toys for summer for her shop, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy an inventory of toys for her shop

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Tuyen is requesting a new loan to buy food for reselling. Tuyen's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is from Lower Lodiong, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 32 years old. Mary is married. 

To make a living, Mary is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. Mary has been in her business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2008, Mary joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock his general store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy would like to take a further loan to buy more clothes to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cau

texts.en:
Cau is a 48-year-old widowed woman. She lives with one son and two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years, she has run a food stall to sell steamed glutinous rice and steamed rice flour with meat for people in her community.

Cau would like a loan to purchase better quality ingredients and foods at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that, through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality ingredients and food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Tsestegmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegmaa is a 45-year-old married woman who lives in Ulaanbaatar city with her family. She supports her family by operating a sewing business since 1994. When she first began her business, it was very hard, since the Mongolian market was very unsteady. 

Year by year, she became more experienced in this kind of business and was able to attract more customers. Most of her customers are very satisfied with her work. Now she needs a leather stitching machine in order to sew leather clothes, jackets, trousers, etc. Thus, Tsetsegmaa is requesting a 600,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy a leather stitching machine to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a leather stitching machine to sew more leather clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Kien

texts.en:
Kien is 29 years old and is married. He has no children and lives with his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker in a garment factory in the local area. 

He has run a electrical product store for four years. He sells electrical tools and appliances and intends to use his loan to buy better quality products to stock his store and better meet the demands of his customers.

He hope his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his plans in the future.

loans.use: To buy better quality electrical products.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old. She lives in Mantik, Tangub City, Philippines. 

Marilou owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of ready-to-wear clothing products to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 3,200 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2009, Marilou joined GDMPC. She simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy good quality rice to sell from her stall. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh would like to take a further loan to buy materials for his business. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more plastic and other materials.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk owns and manages a few hectares of farm lots in her Bak Sna village, Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is now 50 years old and married to her husband, who is also her business partner and assists her in managing their farming business. Together, they have been blessed with five children, two of whom are married and live separately. Uk wants to educate her children and give them a bright future, although she endures the hardships in life.

To satisfy the family’s needs, Uk is requesting a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a motorcycle for household use as well as to support her business. Through this loan, she believes that she will make improvements in her living conditions. In the future, Uk plans to expand her farmland in order to obtain a higher production and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for household use as well as to support her business.

loans.name: 04.12.6 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Hạnh is 45 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 12.6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. Hạnh lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Two other children are grown up.

In 2011, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hạnh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan is requesting a new loan to buy soft drinks to stock her store. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy beverages to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Giri Puteri Group

texts.en:
To further increase the family income, Ni Made is developing her pigs business with borrowed capital from MUK of 2M IDR. 

She lives with her husband, who works as a farmer, and her children, who are still in elementary school. 

Because of the high price of piglets and pigs feed, Ni Made is only able to buy three piglets for fattening at a price of IDR 450,000 per head. She will maintain them for five months. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase pig feed for five months. 

The loan is expected to provide better benefits than the previous loan. And of course the profits will be used for school fees and daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is married with a child. She is 37 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a plot of farmland, cultivating coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 13 years and earns PHP 10,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Judy has been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Judy plans to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 35 años, tiene un hijo de 2 años, al que cuida con mucho esmero. Ella vive en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Huasahuasi.
Se dedica a la agricultura y aprovecha los buenos suelos de su localidad para producir papas de distintas variedades y algo de arvejas. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a esto y es consciente que con esmero puede obtener buenas ganancias de sus productos. Viviana sola no puede abastecerse para atender todos sus cultivos, por eso contrata personal operario a quienes paga por el día de trabajo. Para esas jornadas ella cocina en la mañana y en la tarde. A su vez, produce quesos de la leche que obtiene de sus vacas, pero también compra más quesos de otras personas para venderlos en la ciudad. De esa manera obtiene ingresos que puede ahorrar para forjarse un futuro mejor.

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por eso menciona que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Capital semillera”, donde sus socios son personas muy trabajadoras.
Con el dinero de este préstamo podrá adquirir semilla de papa y bolsas de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Viviana is 35 years old, she has a 2-year-old son and she cares for him with all her heart.  She lives with her parents in the agricultural district of Huasahuasi.

She works in agriculture and takes advantage of the good soil in her region to grow potatoes of distinct varieties, and she also grows some peas.  She has done this work for more than 10 years and she knows that with care she can earn a good income from her products.  She alone cannot work all of her land, so she hires workers that she can pay by the day.  On the days she has the workers, she cooks in the morning and in the afternoon.  In turn, she produces cheese from the milk that her cows produce, but she also buys cheese from other people that sell it in the city.  This is how she earns an income that enables her to save to forge a better future.

This is her 11th credit with MFP, and because of this she says that she will be punctual with her payments.  She belongs to the community bank "Capital Semillera" where the members are hard-working people.

With the money from this loan, she will be able to buy potato seeds and bags of fertilizer for her next planting.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.es:
Cerila tiene 47 años, su esposo es Fortunato, con quien tiene cinco hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Rundo. 
Su principal actividad es la agricultura, junto a su esposo dedican su tiempo a la siembra de papa, maíz y olluco en sus terrenos y en otros alquilados, pues a veces no se abastecen para la producción. En cada cosecha, después de meses de mucho esfuerzo, la vende en la ciudad de Lima, donde su esposo viaja constantemente. Pero como ella gustan los animales, cría 6 vacas de buena calidad, todas ellas lecheras, de las que extrae la leche que necesita para realiza queso, 10 moldes al día, los que vende en la ciudad. Asimismo, sus hijas mayores le envían una pensión con lo que piensa invertir en aumentar su producción agrícola.

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Rundo al progreso” y este es su crédito número 10 con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo financiero recibido durante todo este tiempo. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Y además le agrada pertenecer a su grupo, donde las personas son responsables y solidarias. 
Cerila invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Cerila is 47 years old. Her husband is Fortunato and they have five children who they care for in their own house, which is located in the town of Rundo.

Farming is her main activity. Cerila and her husband spend their time growing potatoes, corn, and ulluco on their own land and in fields that they lease. Sometimes they do not have the supplies required for production. With each harvest, after months of hard work, her products are sold in the city of Lima where her husband travels constantly. Cerila also enjoys working with animals and has six dairy cows of good quality. She extracts as much milk as she needs to make cheeses, usually 10 molds per day, and then sells them in the city. At the same time, her older daughters oversee an eatery and she plans to to invest the profits from that venture so that she can increase her farm production.

Cerila is a member of the Communal Bank "Rundo al Progreso" and this is her 10th loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support she has received throughout this entire time. Cerila promises to be punctual with her loan payments. She is glad to be part of her group since all of the people are responsible and supportive. Cerila will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to apply on her crops during the next planting season.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Khuong

texts.en: Khuong is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit for selling from his stall and also to repair his motorbike. This loan will help him to better satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food shop and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and higher quality of fruit for selling from his stall and also to repair his motorbike.

loans.name: Unión Estrellas De Senkata Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “UNIÓN ESTRELLAS DE SENKATA” inicia su primer ciclo en el Centro Focal de  Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes donde la señora Evelia es la presidenta.  Las actividades que desarrollan dentro del grupo son distintos, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de papa. 
La señora Evelia cuenta que es la primera vez que integra una Banca Comunal dentro de Pro Mujer y que para esto fue invitada por las vecinas; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, mismo que trabaja hace varios años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de verduras y cereales) los que comprarán de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo apoya a salir adelante a su familia pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.
Cuando le consultamos que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella nos respondió que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud.
texts.en:
The “UNIÓN ESTRELLAS DE SENKATA” group is in its first cycle in the Centro Focal de Senkata and is comprised of six members.  Evelia is the president.  The activities of the group members are varied.  Between them they sell food, run a neighborhood shop, sell clothes, and sell potatoes.

Evelia tells us that this is her first time that she found a community bank like Pro Mujer and she was invited by her neighbors to join.  She has a food-selling business and has worked for many years learning this work, which was also the trade of her mother.

This loan will help her to increase her merchandise (she will buy vegetables and cereals) that she will buy in the markets of the city of El Alto and then will sell in her own market stall.  This work helps her support her family, as she is married and has three children.

When we asked why she liked Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Lorena Teresa

texts.es:
Lorena nació en enero de 1991. Ella vive en Solanda con su esposo e hija, un barrio en el sur de la capital del Ecuador, Quito. La ciudad de Quito está situada en la cordillera de los Andes a 2.800 metros sobre el nivel del mar, haciéndola la 3era capital más alta del mundo. En 1978, Quito fue nombrado Primer Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO por un paisaje que combina naturaleza e infraestructura de una manera única en su categoría. Quito se divide en tres partes: el Centro Histórico; donde se preserva el Quito colonial, el Norte; donde tradicionalmente se sitúan las clases socioeconómicas altas, y el Sur; conocido como “el lado pobre” de la ciudad. 
Lorena empezó un negocio de venta de material de calzado hace 3 años. Su esposo es empleado privado y ella trabaja de 8:00am a 8:00pm. Lorena finalizo sus estudios secundarios, pero no pudo continuar ya que su hija llego al mundo y Lorena tenía que luchar por el bienestar de la niña. Eso fue lo que le motivo a abrir su negocio, y lo que le motiva a seguir creciendo. Por lo tanto, ella solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder comprar y vender más material y conseguir a gente que le ayude en la movilización de este ya que es muy pesado para ella sola. De esta manera ella le podrá brindar un mejor futuro a su hija y comprarse su casa propia en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lorena was born in January 1991.  She lives in Solanda with her husband and daughter.  This is a neighborhood in the south of Quito, the capital of Ecuador.  The city of Quito is located on the Andean mountain range, 2,800 meters above sea level.  It is the third highest capital city in the world.  In 1978, Quito was named the first World Heritage Site by UNESCO because of its landscape which combines nature and infrastructure in a unique way in its category.  Quito is divided into thee parts: the historic center where colonial Quito is preserved; the north, where the upper classes traditionally live; and the south, known as the 'poor side' of the city.

Lorena started a business selling footwear three years ago.  Her husband is a private employee and she works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  Lorena finished high school but couldn't continue her education as her daughter was born and she had to work hard to provide for her well-being.  This is what motivated her to open her business and what motivates her to continue growing it.  She is requesting this Kiva loan so that she can buy and sell more materials and to get people to help her in transporting it all because it is very heavy for her to do alone.  In this way, she will be able to provide her daughter with a better future and buy her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoe materials to sell

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 39 year-old, married woman with two children. Linh lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For six years, she and her husband have operated a food stall where they sell meals to people in their community. 

Linh would like a loan to purchase new furniture for her stall and to repair the motorcycle that she uses to transport foods between the local market and her stall. 

She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her stall and to repair the motorcycle she uses to transport foods between the local market and her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of shellfish to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Nghia

texts.en:
Nghia is a 39-year-old single man. He lives with his mother in Ho Chi Minh city. He supports his family by selling noodles to the people in his local community, which he has done for 10 years. 

Nghia would like to borrow a loan to buy a larger quantity and higher quality of foods to sell from his stall. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes his business will run smoothly and he can earn additional income to reinvest in his shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity and higher quality of foods to sell from his stall.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 45 años, es una señora muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive con su esposo Jorge, de 45 años, en la casa que compraron juntos durante 8 años de relación. Sus cinco hijos ya son mayores e independientes, y los visitan en sus tiempos libres.

Ella tiene un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad, el cual muy visitado, debido al buen trato que brinda y porque es el primer en abrir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y con sus compañeras del mercado, y a pesar de la competencia es la única que vende, adicionalmente, helados, galletas y bebidas. Esta labor la lleva realizando hace 8 años y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el transcurso del día en su puesto.

Con los 2,000 nuevos soles de este préstamo comprará lo necesario para su tienda, en especial los ricos helados que tanto le exige su clientela.
texts.en:
Olga, age 45, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband Jorge, age 45, in the house they purchased together during their relationship of eight years. Her five children are grown and independent, so they visit her in their free time.

Olga has a grocery stand at the market in her town that is visited often due to the good service she provides and also because it is the first establishment that is open. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to talk with her customers and the other proprietors at the market. Despite the competition, she is the only vendor who also sells ice cream, cookies, and beverages. Olga has been in this line of work for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be having to remain at her stand all day.

With the 2,000 PEN that she will receive from this loan, Olga will buy what she needs for her shop, especially the delicious ice cream that is demanded by her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery stand.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita tiene 26 años, es soltera y vive con uno de sus hermanos menores en la casa de sus padres.
Desde niña aprendió el trabajo en el campo, ahora que sus padres le heredaron unos terrenos siembra allí habas, arvejas, espinacas, zanahorias y otros productos. Ella sabe que sus productos tienen buena demanda en la ciudad de Lima (capital), por eso al cosecharlos viaja hasta allá para llegar al mercado mayorista. “A veces viajo o sino solo envío la carga a los compradores porque ya me conocen”, menciona. También compra más productos en su zona y los envía, porque hay meses donde la demanda es mayor y tiene que abastecer todos sus pedidos. Rita está emocionada porque este mes es crucial para la siembra de hortalizas, ya que en la cosecha no tendrá pierde y sus precios serán favorables.

Este sería su préstamo número 3 con MFP. Ella da su palabra al decir que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, y se siente bien al formar parte de un banco comunal responsable llamado “Las ángeles de la unión 2”.
Con este préstamo podrá comprar bolsas de abono orgánico para esparcir en sus sembríos de arvejas, habas y espinacas, las que sembró el mes pasado.
texts.en:
Rita is 26 years old, single, and lives in her parents’ house along with one of her younger brothers. As a child she learned about working in the fields, and now that she has inherited land from her parents, she grows beans, peas, spinach, carrots and other crops there. She knows that there is great demand for them in the capital city, Lima, so after harvesting the produce, she travels there to the wholesale market. “Sometimes I go there myself,” she says, “and sometimes I send the vegetables as the buyers there know me.” As well, she sometimes buys more produce in the nearby area and sends it too because there is a greater demand in some months so she cannot fulfill all the orders herself. 

Rita is excited because this month is a crucial one for sowing the vegetables. You can’t be late, and prices are good at the moment.

This will be Rita’s third loan with MFP. She gives her word that she will be punctual with the repayments. She is pleased to be part of her community bank which is made up of responsible members. It is called  Las Angeles de la Unión 2. With the loan Rita plans to buy bags of organic fertilizer to spread on the crops of peas, beans, and spinach that she sowed last month.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new products (drinking water and other beverages, food and candy) to sell in his general store

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es:
Gisela tiene 27 años, tiene un hijo de 5 años. Vive con su pareja e hijo en la casa sus padres ubicada en el distrito de La Unión.
Desde que tiene a su pequeño hijo se esfuerza en lo que mejor sabe hacer, la agricultura, la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Por eso tiene que atender a sus cultivos de arvejas, habas, maíz y otros productos con el apoyo de su esposo. “El trabajo del campo es cansado, pero cuando vendo veo que vale la pena tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. En sus 5 años como agricultora aprendió lo que el clima y la falta de lluvias pueden provocar, por eso ahora sale muy temprano de su hogar para llevar agua hacia sus cultivos mediante canales que ella misma abre con las herramientas del campo. Ahora piensa sembrar arvejas y habas, porque se acerca la temporada donde suben los precios de estos productos. Tiene planeado arrendar un terreno más para sembrar en mayor cantidad.

Este su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se siente comprometida en pagar puntualmente las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las ángeles de la unión 2” donde todas sus socias son mujeres trabajadoras.
Invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arvejas, ya que cuenta con ahorros que le permitirán adquirir abono.
texts.en:
Gisela is 27 years old and has a 5-year-old son.  She lives with her partner and son in her parents' home which is located in La Unión district.

Since she gave birth to her young son, Gisela has worked hard at what she knows best: farming.  This is her main source of income.  She cares for her peas, green beans, corn and other crops with the support of her husband.  "Farm work is tiring but when I sell my crops, I see that all of the hard work has been worthwhile", she says.  In her five years as a farmer, Gisela has learned what damage the climate and a lack of rain can cause.  For this reason, she gets up very early at home to direct water to her crops through channels that she herself makes with farm tools.  Right now she is planning to sow peas and green beans because we are approaching the season where the price paid for these crops increases.  She plans to rent an additional plot of land so that she can grow her crops in larger quantities.

This is Gisela's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She is a member of the 'Las ángeles de la unión 2' community bank.  All of this group's members are hard-working women.

Gisela will invest her loan money in buying a bag of pea seeds as she already has some savings which will allow her to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds

loans.name: Dionela

texts.es:
Dionela tiene 22 años, su pareja es Nilton, con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años. Esta familia tiene una casa propia que Nilton heredó de sus padres.	Edad, estado civil.
Ella es una joven madre muy responsable, todo su esfuerzo es por el desarrollo de su familia. Cuenta con tres terrenos que sus suegros le otorgaron donde siembra espinaca, alfalfa, arvejas, orégano, manzanilla y otros productos. Gracias a su destreza para los negocios viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima (capital), donde los precios son mejores. A su corta edad ya ha experimentado ciertos fracasos o pérdidas en su producción, las que se debieron en su mayoría, a la falta de capital. Pero con empeño y trabajo duro ha logrado adquirir un terreno donde empezó a sembrar maíz. Con el apoyo de su pareja puede atender sus cultivos y así aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida para su pequeño hijo.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto al trabajo con su banco comunal “Las ángeles de la unión”, muestra identificación por tener socias solidarias.
Invertirá este dinero en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico, los que esparcirá en sus sembríos de espinacas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Dionela is 22 years old and lives with her partner, Nilton.  The couple have a 3-year-old son and live in their own home which Nilton inherited from his parents.

Dionela is a very responsible young mother.  She makes all of her efforts for the sake of her family.  She has three plots of farmland which her in-laws gave her where she grows spinach, alfalfa, peas, oregano, camomile and other crops.  Thanks to her business skills, she travels to the city of Lima (the country's capital city) where she can earn better prices.  At her young age, she has already experienced some failures or losses in her production which were mainly due to a lack of capital.  However, with determination and hard work, she has managed to acquire a plot of land where she has started to grow corn.  With the support of her partner, she is able to tend to her crops and thereby aspire to a better quality of life for their young son.

This is Dionela's third loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  She is happy to work with her community bank, 'Las ángeles de la unión', as the members are all supportive.

Dionela will invest this money in buying sacks of organic fertilizers which she will spread over her spinach and pea crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is a 40-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Yen and her husband earn a living through a small business of selling motorcycle parts. They have run this business for 10 years.

Yen would like to take a loan to buy materials to produce more motorcycle parts to sell. She hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This will help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce more motorcycle parts to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has three children. She has a well-stocked store that supplies her neighborhood. She started with a small food counter, and then she decided to change her business and make a living through the store. Her business is doing very well. She has good customers since she is friendly with them and all of her products are priced well.

Jackline is requesting this loan to buy sugar, tea, noodles, pastries and drinks. This will help her business have a good amount of stock and give her family members what they need. She describes herself as a hardworking person with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea, noodles, pastries and drinks.

loans.name: Loc

texts.en:
Loc is a 49-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Loc and her husband support their family by running a business selling beverages and motorcycle brakes, which they have done for 15 years. 

Loc would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity beverages and motorcycle brakes to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate more income. This will help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages and motorcycle brakes to sell.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien was born in 1976. She has three children, two sons in high school and a one-year-old daughter. Her husband is a driver and earns 5,000,000 VND. Lien is a tailor. Each month she earns 3,000,000 VND, bringing the family's total income to 8,000,000 VND. Lien has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2010. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy cloth for her tailoring business, which she wants to expand.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her tailor shop

loans.name: Mbulah

texts.en:
Mbulah, a widowed mother of two grown children, farms vegetables that she later sells at various street markets and at her retail shop. She is a very hardworking, self-sacrificing woman because everything she does is to provide her family with the best.

Mbulah wants to expand production to provide her family with a better standard of living and so is requesting this loan to expand vegetable production through the purchase of more tools, seeds, and supplies.

loans.use: to buy more tools, seeds, and supplies.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong, a 58-year-old divorced woman, lives with her two children in Ho Chi Minh City. For 15 years she has operated a cafe in front of her house and is requesting a loan to upgrade the floor of her house and to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffees to stock in her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

Dong also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to upgrade the floor of her house and to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffees to stock in her store.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariam is a mother of seven children, four of whom are in school, while three are still too young to attend. Mariam previously made a living by farming, selling her produce of vegetables and fruits; with her savings she opened up a food stand from home, her customers her neighbours. Infrequently she travels to Mombasa to bring back produce because she still gets orders.

Mariam is requesting this loan to purchase bread products, meats, oils, vegetables and other ingredients to make the meals she serves at the stand.

loans.use: to purchase bread products, meats, oils, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Teófila

texts.es:
Teófila tiene 34 años, su pareja desde hace 12 años es Kleiber, de 37 años. La casa donde viven la compraron al iniciar su vida juntos.
Ella tiene un puesto de ropa en el mercado de su distrito; comenta que antes se dedicaba a la agricultura y con las ganancias de sus cosechas llegó a comprar variedad de prendas de vestir y de esa manera empezó su nuevo negocio hace un año. Normalmente labora sola, pero cuando realiza el viaje para traer mercadería de la ciudad de Lima (capital), deja a cargo a su pareja y a otra persona quien esté al tanto de la atención. Para más adelante desea comprar estantes y maniquíes para que la gente vea la ropa que ofrece en su puesto.

Con los 1,500 nuevos soles de este préstamo se abastecerá de más ropa, especialmente para niños y jóvenes, es lo que más solicitan en su puesto.
texts.en:
Teófila is 34 years old. Her partner of 12 years, Kleiber, is 37 years old. They live in a house that they purchased when they started their life together.

Teófila has a clothing stand at the market in her district. She says that she used to earn her living as a farmer and saved the profits from a year's worth of harvests to purchase various articles of clothing so that she could start a new business. Teófila normally works alone, but when a trip has to be made to the capital city of Lima in order to bring back merchandise, she delegates that responsibility to her partner and one other person. Going forward, she would like to buy shelves and mannequins so that people can see the clothes that she offers in her establishment.

The loan of 1,500 PEN will help her restock with more clothing, especially items for children and young people, since these are the most requested products at her shop.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tasiana

texts.en: Tasiana is the loving and hard-working mother of two children who has earned a living for the last five years by farming green vegetables, tomatoes and onions. Little by little, she has been able to expand what she grows, and now sells her produce to many of her neighbors. Her dream is to grow and expand her business, but working capital is in short supply. That is why she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first from the Yehu Microfinance Trust, to buy seedlings, pesticides and a water pump. Wherever possible, she will buy in bulk to get substantial discounts. She is very excited about the prospect of receiving this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, pesticides and a water pump.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: A married mother of four, Cecilia is an entrepreneur who has made progress toward her goals thanks to her capacity for work and love for her family. Cecilia generates family income by growing green vegetables, tomatoes and onions, a business she began 20 years ago. She is now requesting a Kiva loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers which she will be able to get at substantial discounts by buying in large volume. This loan will lay the groundwork for the success that Cecilia envisages.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married with a child. Merlinda is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Merlinda is a farmer and she manages a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years and every month she earn 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Merlinda has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Merlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is married and working to improve her family's well being by selling charcoal to people who live in her neighborhood. She is requesting her first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization which she joined a year ago and which has made it possible for her to set up her business and live a more comfortable life. She will use this loan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers, and earn more money by selling to new customers who are referred to her by her current customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a 34-year-old married mom with four children.

To make a living, Maribel plants, harvests, and sells vegetables for a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Maribel is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Maribel has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ochirbat, 26, works in the steel factory which is in Darkhan, the second largest city. He has been doing his job for 2 years, and is one of the skillful workers. He wanted to buy a car which runs on natural gas. According his plan, he will run a taxi business outside his work. He believes it will increase his family income notably.

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world.  This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C even in the cities.  Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms.  Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm.  As well, the smoky and extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons for Mongolian hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars on the natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Ochirbat is taking will be used to cover the cost of his buying a car which uses natural gas.

loans.use: To cover the cost of his buying a car which uses natural gas.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is married and has eight children who attend school.  They live in Mwambalazi, Mombasa, where he works as a farmer. For the past eight years, he’s been farming green vegetables, potatoes and onions to sell to support his home. 

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business.  He plans to use this loan to buy bundles of seedlings and fertilizers at a better price than usual because he has the capacity to buy at wholesale with his Kiva loan.  That will make the investment successful, and this is why he’s very competitive when he sells the products.  He earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en: Perveen has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her husband’s livestock business by buying a buffalo. He will raise the buffalo and sell it for a profit when it is grown. He will also sell its milk to gain extra income. Perveen's husband has been in this line of work for many years, and she is confident that the loan will help him earn more profits. She is a very supportive wife and helps her husband in his business by milking their cattle and also keeping their home clean.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for a livestock business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha lives in Mwambalazi, Mombasa. She works every day because her dream is to have a store that is well-known in her town. In order to do this, she sells household items to her retailers as wholesale. With this, she has managed to save and invest in another business that has provided the opportunity to generate new income. She also farms as her other source of income. Meanwhile, Tabitha can earn extra money. 

The lack of working capital is her biggest challenge, this is why she has turned to Kiva for her sixth loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With her Kiva loan she will buy bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, an beans which are in high demand. Her loan should be successful because her sales are based on customer orders. What she buys has a fast turnover, which causes her working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase her profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of her capital and thereby her earnings.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat flour, sugar, maize flour, and beans.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 39 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur with her two children. She supports her family by running a "sari-sari" (or general) store where she sells products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for six years and earns 10,000 PHP from her work. In 2009, Marites joined GDMPC as a way to improve her business, and is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy new items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Vorn is 35 and married with three school-aged children who still need her support. She lives in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. For the past 12 years, Vorn has rented a small stall at a local market to sell fresh fish and vegetables to earn an income. She earns approximately 5 USD per day.  In addition, Vorn always helps her husband with his rice farming business, especially in rainy season.

Vorn is requesting a second loan of 1,100 USD to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This motorcycle will better satisfy her family's living needs and let them go anywhere easily without paying transportation fees. In the future, Vorn aims to raise piglets and sell them for profit.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en: Zubaida is married and helps her husband in his dairy business, which he has been running for many years and which has a good reputation in his community because he sells very good quality milk at reasonable rates. Zubaida has given birth to three sons, all of whom are enrolled in a local school where they are getting a good education. Zubaida is a great housewife and mother, and takes her responsibilities very seriously. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her husband’s dairy business. She and her husband will use the loan to buy another buffalo because the demand for milk is so high that he is unable to fill all his current orders. Zubaida is confident that her husband will make good use of loan and successfully increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo to expand a dairy business.

loans.name: Presidita

texts.en:
Presidita is married with three children. She is 52 years old, and resides at Magsaysay, Panaon, Philippines.

Presidita cultivates coconuts for a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

Presidita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She joined GDMPC in 2010. In the future, Presidita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nchalika

texts.en:
Nchalika is a divorced woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in Mwambalazi, where she works selling petrol and diesel to support her family. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business. She plans to use this loan to buy petrol and diesel at a much more special price than usual because she has the capacity to buy at wholesale with her Kiva loan. This will make the investment successful and is why Nchalika is very competitive when she sells her products and why she earns more each time.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel for resale.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is married and has three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. 

Jenifer operates a transportation business, using a trisikad (pedicab), for a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Jenifer has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Jenifer wants to make improvements to her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 45 years old and has two adult children.  She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She is a very clever, alive, and emotional woman. She is a professional chef and has worked in many organizations. 

Altantsetseg does not own a house and has been living in her cousin’s house for many years. She has overcome much hardship in her life time. During these years, her cousin has supported and encouraged her as he much as can so she is very grateful. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a loan for 2,500,000 MNT, which she will use to renovate the house and buy furniture to show her gratitude to her cousin.

loans.use: to renovate the house and purchase furniture.

loans.name: Muthula

texts.en:
Mutula is a married man and has twelve children, six of whom still attend school.  They live in Mwambalazi, Mombasa, where he works at his farm. For the past ten years, he’s been operating his farm selling vegetables and fruits to earn a living.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business more each time and plans to use this loan to start another business.  He wants to purchase fuel for resale at a much better price than usual because he has the capacity to buy at wholesale with his Kiva loan, which will make the investment successful.

loans.use: to start another business, purchase fuel for resale

loans.name: Poderoso De Israel 1, 2, 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the group, Poderoso de Israel (The Powerful of Israel) 1, 2, 3 and 5; the name is an allusion to JesusChrist. They are from a rural batey of Romana, Dominican Republic. She lives in a batey, a rural community built by sugar companies for their workers. Bateyes are made up of the homes of some of the poorest people in the Dominican Republic, especially Haitians.


Isabel lives with her three children and her long-term partner, her children's father.  She said that her most difficult challenge has been to generate enough money to provide for her family and to develop her business.  Isabel runs a business where she sells different clothing for men, women and kids. With her loan, she plans to buy more clothes and increase the inventory. Isabel is very thankful for this loan, and she hopes to continue her successful borrowing in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Because of her need to generate an income to  improve her family’s well-being, Susan began her business of selling clothes. Susan is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.  Susan is requesting a second loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust.  She has been a part of this organization for two years. Yehu Microfinance Trust made it possible for her to set up her business in order to give it a more comfortable environment. She will use the loan to buy bundles of clothes for resale, and will be able to respond to new customers who have been referred by the current buyers and whose attention she wants to capture.  She will buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for cash and large volume.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
For over 4 years in Panduma, Tukuran, Vevencia, a 55-year-old married mother of 4 children, has made a living through the operation of a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vevencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo Antonio, de 50 años de edad, casado, con dos  hijos  los cuales tiene a su cargo y le ayudas en los estudios tiene  por actividad economica un taller de servicio de enderazado y pintura, actividad en la que tiene por experiencia 20 años , de los cuales tiene 9 años de haber inico su negocio propio con un poco de esfuerzo propio, y el apoyo que fundacion tambien le ha dado con los financiamiento el  prestamos lo necesita para la compra de material de trabajo como:  soldador, prensa, taladro, lijadora, pistola de pintura, pulidora, desarmador, alicate. Entre otros.
texts.en: Wilfredo Antonio is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children in his charge whom he helps with their studies. He has operated a paint and body shop for 9 years, and has 20 years experience in this work. Wilfredo began his shop with his own efforts and the financial help of loans through the Fundacion Leon. The loan he now needs is for purchasing work tools such as a welder, clamps, drill, sander, paint sprayer, polisher, screwdriver, and pliers, among other items.

loans.use: buy a welder, clamps, drill, sander, paint sprayer, polisher, screwdriver, and pliers, among other tools.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en:
Mehman is a 36-year-old man who is a farmer. He is married and has two sons. For the last 10 years, he has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has gained the necessary skills to successfully run the business. He sells his crops in the central bazaar and to the neighbors. His monthly income is 120 AZN. His father helps him to raise the crops. 

Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular among Azerbaijani people; they eat it fresh every day, and make fresh juices and punches. Many local dishes such as dolma are made of boiled vegetables.  

Now Mehman would like to raise more crops. For this purpose he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He will buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 28-year-old resident of Villalin, Panaon. She provides for her three childrens' needs from the little amount of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) she gains monthly from her own banana and coconut plantation business. She has had this business for 2 years as an aid to the income earned by her husband.

In 2009, Elna became a member of GDMPC, and now she applies for a loan from GDMPC microfinance of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Sadiniso

texts.en: Sadiniso has been selling lingerie for 10 years. This is her own business, which is situated in the Panjshanbe market. Panjshanbe is the most popular place for trade in the area, and thus the trade here should be better. Sadiniso now wants to expand her business by buying new goods for the coming season. Sadiniso hopes for your understanding and support.

loans.use: to buy a new range of lingerie and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rahib

texts.en: Rahib is a 19-year-old student at the State Economy University. He is in his second year there and is going to complete his education in 2013. He studies Road Police Management, and he will be a master of Police Management when he gets his diploma. His parents are working and paying his tuition. Rahib needs to pay for his last year of education. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan. He is going to find a job so he can repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages eleven and two, in their small house in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His wife is studying to be a train conductor and will finish in November 2012. Byambadorj has been working as a taxi driver for five years. 

Recently, he has exchanged his old car for another second-hand one, a Honda Fit, which consumes less fuel and saves more money for his family. Unfortunately, his car has broken down, so Byambadorj is requesting 1,300,000 MNT to completely overhaul his car. By doing so, he can work for a few more years without worrying about the car.

loans.use: To overhaul his car, which he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Gan-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Gan-Erdene, 45, lives with his wife and 2 children, ages 21 and 14, in a small wooden house in Erdenet, the third biggest city of Mongolia. He has been working in a local mining company as a lathe operator since 1994. Gan-Erdene’s wife is a disabled person, so he is the only one who works in the family. His daughter studies at a local university and his son is a high-school student. While his children are growing, Gan-Erdene’s house seems smaller. So, he has decided to take a 4,500,000 MNT loan to build a big, but energy efficient, house. It means that he will be able to add good wall insulation to his house. Average temperatures of the country are around -30° C from November through March, and are about freezing in April and October. January and February averages of -20° C are common, with winter nights of -40° C occurring most years. He said that “Using less energy to heat the house will be his contribution to the environment, and every person should do that”.

loans.use: To build a big, but energy efficient house

loans.name: Jolly's Group

texts.en:
Jolly's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Jolly is 17 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jolly has been working hard to manage her small hotel, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Jolly has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food for cooking, and will help Jolly to generate greater profits and pay for her medical expenses. Jolly hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build on it. 

Jolly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Jolly's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food for cooking dishes served at the hotel

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en: Mrs. Solongo, 22, lives with her husband and 2-year-old child in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic yurt. They live on her father-in-law’s land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. They are a young couple who have recently started living separately from their parents. Solongo is a young, energetic woman with a desire to create new and big things. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been working in a small company as an architect for one year, and has gained a lot of experience. Mongolia is a rapidly developing country in Asia; the proof is skyscraping cranes located everywhere in Ulaanbaatar. Construction projects are promising a huge profit and dozens of companies are building apartments. Solongo doesn’t have enough time for her family, because the company where she works has plenty of work to be done. For this reason, she works at the company from morning till night. Solongo is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a PC with new software so she can do some of her work at home. This will enable her to spend more time with her family. In the future, she wants to own her own architecture company, and the PC will help her reach her goals.

loans.use: To purchase a PC

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is married and 30 years of age. She is an embroidery expert and does beautiful embroidery of clothes. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. 

Her husband is a truck driver and provides goods transport services to his clients. 

Shazia is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Two of them are studying while her other children are very young. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her embroidery business. 

With the loan investment she will buy embroidery material such as beads, thread etc. in bulk, which will allow her to fulfill larger orders on time and increase her profits. 

She is very experienced in her work and confident about her business success.

loans.use: To buy beads and thread for an embroidery business

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Fatima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for further expansion of her husband’s agricultural business. He purchases wheat, corn and other agricultural items at wholesale and sells at a profit.

Ghulam Fatima knows the art of sewing and sews beautiful-looking clothes for her neighboring clients.  She is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Three of them are studying, while the other two are not of school age yet.  She is confident that her decision to receive a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, will be a productive one for her husband.
Note:"In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Ghulam Fatima."

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn for selling at profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Mr.Erdenebayar is 37 years old, and lives with his family in a Mongolian nomadic tent /yurt on his plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Erdenebayar is a hardworking person of integrity.  He has 3 children, ages15, 11, and 7, all of whom go to the secondary school not far from their home. Mr. Eredenebayar has been running in a taxi business as a taxi-driver for several years. 

His wife is a seamstress and usually sews deels, Mongolian traditional coats.  She is a very talented needlewoman, so she gets plenty of orders from her clients. She uses an old mechanical sewing machine with low productivity, which came from her mother.  It doesn’t allow her to sew more deels no matter how hard she tries. Erdenebayar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to replace his wife’s sewing machine with an electric one. In the future, Erdenebayar wants to build a bigger house on his plot of land, and to create a comfortable condition for his children.

loans.use: To replace his wife’s sewing machine with an electric one.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a son. She describes herself as honest and humble. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a viable business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more clothes for selling. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a permanent business premise.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Tang is a hardworking 65-year-old woman who always looks out for the welfare of her family. She is married to a humble farmer and has four married children. All of them are independent and live separately. However far they live away from their parents, they often get in touch and come to visit their old parents. Even though Tang recently received financial support from her children, she doesn't completely depend on her children. Tang, at her age, still works hard to generate income for herself. She sells breakfast and lunch to people around her neighborhood, earning approximately $4.00 per day. 

One of Tang's daughters sells vegetables in a local market of the Baray district, Kompong Tom. In order to help her daughter increase her sales, Tang wants to borrow $1,000 to purchase potatoes in bulk from local farmers. Her daughter will continue to sell them to traders in their village for additional income. Also, she will retail some at the market. Tang is confident that this loan will help her expand the business and lead to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk for trading.

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. Elueteria has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, & beverages. She had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Elueteria joined HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Elueteria hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is still operating her clothes, shoes and flower businesses. She runs her clothes and shoe business in a rented place. Thanks to her occupations, she is able to provide for herself and to financially help her daughters' families.  With her previous Kiva loan, Svetlana  bought a large lot of clothes to resell and also expanded her flower business. 
Now she is asking for a 500,000 AMD loan to buy summer season clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy summer season clothes to sell
